reviews.review: Best views for free in Tokyo. There are other higher points of panorama view in Tokyo, but I would definitely recommend this one as you can see all what you need to see and it is for free. We went just before sunset and could see the day-night transition. Superb
Great observation deck. Free observation deck, under cover, overlooks all Tokyo and out to Mt Fuji. Has a gift shop and restaurant.
Do it!. Great views and all for free!!!!! You do need to go on a clear day. There is a terrific souvenir shop there with interesting things.
Amazing view !. Amazing view ! Do not charge a fees for entrance ! Easy to get there by public transport. Located in Shinjuku area .

Great view for free. Went here after reading reviews on trip advisor. Really easy to find and there is direct access from the metro station great 360 (almost) views all for free we went on a clear day and could see for miles. Not very busy when we went so only short queues but it moves quickly,

Fantastic views...and for free!. Located in Shinjuku, the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building allows you to visit the top of the towers and enjoy spectacular views of Tokyo. Why pay for Tokyo SkyTree or Tokyo Tower when you can enjoy similar views here for free?The top floor offers souvenirs shops and also a restaurant, although I did not have the chance to enjoy it as it was fully booked.
Cool views . The view plus the price (free) makes this a great place to see the cityscape. Not a replacement but a cheaper alternative to the Tokyo tower.

Well worth a (free) visit. Choose either tower, I chose south but it shouldn't make a difference.You have great views over Tokyo, for free! After visiting the sky tree, which is taller but further from the city, I much prefer the closer view you have from here of the Tokyo cityscape.
Amazing views . Brilliant views from the top, not too busy either so easy to get close to the windows. Plus its free. What more could you ask for?
Great view on Shinjuku - Tokyo. Mount Fujii was there, far over the horizon and viewing it both during the day and in the night is an exciting experience. You need to try at Sunset
Great views, lovely staff and good food. It took us a while to find the building but when we did it was well worth it, the views where just as good as paid viewing platforms.
Supers view. The view from up there is a amazing, but you don't go outside, you have to take pictures behind the windows. A bit expensive but worth the visit on a sunny day.
Better views than Sky Tree or Tokyo Tower!. This place isnt as popular as the other high towers but offers up some great views of Tokyo. Fewer people and better views! What could be better?

Best value. it's free and it's a great way to get a perspective on Tokyo. We visited it our first full day in Tokyo. A lovely lady gave us a great guide for our viewing and answered lots of questions .

Great view of Fuji. We visited the viewing floor at sunset and were treated to amazing views of Fuji, Shinjuku and the Tokyo sky line.
We waited roughly 10 minutes to catch the elevator, but this was run very efficiently in true Japanese fashion.
There are a number of shops and a restaurant too.
Worth a visit and amazingly it is free to enter.

Great views and it's free!. The Observation deck on the 45th floor gives you great views out over Shinjuku, and best of all it is free! We went on a clear night and the city looks like a million stars twinkling in the distance. The entrance can be tricky to find when the building's main doors are closed, but the friendly guards directed us to the after hours entrance. There is a restaurant and gift shop on the Observation deck as well.
Free fast and fun. Wow. What a big city you realize from the 45th floor of the North Tower. I might even plan lunch up there next time. You can even see Mt . Fuji.

Sprawling Tokyo. This is a great place to see just how large and sprawling Tokyo is. The view from both towers is good and the best part is that it is free! This is a wonderful amenity offered by the city.
Great Tokyo View. Best option to see the city from above, forget Sky Tree and Tokyo Tower and go to the government building. The view is as pretty as the others and it is totally free!

Must visit. This is a free attraction in the heart of Tokyo. There are fabulous views from 45 floors up. There are several lifts. At the 45th floor are shops and a coffee shop. At ground level if you aren't sure where to go the staff are very helpful in pointing out the correct doors to exit by etc. We wanted to visit the nearby park so a staff member showed us how to get there.

Good view for free. You can see the whole of Tokyo for free from the viewing platform in Shinjuku. Better to visit here than pay for a visit elsewhere. The lifts are fast and the glass viewing area covers all sides.

Great view and its all free!. It was great going up there and to watch the amazing view in almost 360°
And its all free!
highly recommended

Great city views. Recommended to get great city views of all sides of the city. To get the full experience go up both the north and south tours and do at night as well as in the day. It's free too. On a clear day you can see Mount Fuji. Signs for what you are seeing are often above your head so look up as well as at the view.

Nice view, free access, opened until late at night (11 pm). Access is easy from both towers in building #1.The view is free, no reservation or ticket is needed. There's a quick handbag check at the entrance. Bottles and batteries are accepted...You also can have a look at night, it's open until 11 pm. Be aware that each tower is closed once a week (check Tokyo government website for more details). Less people on weekdays.The café upstairs closes at 10 pm.

Great sunset views. Quick visit during a business meeting to view Mt Fuji. Visibility lower down was poor but 45 floors up and it was spectacular! It's free and there were no queues. There is a shop at the top and I think a restaurant. Well worth the trip.

Nice view of Tokyo and it's free!. We went there in the late afternoon on a clear sunny day and were a bit surprised that the place was not crowded at all. Interesting building and impressive 360 degree view of Tokyo from high and above. Can imagine the night view would be quite magic. Free entry and the souvenir shop carries a wide range of goods.

Amazing view for FREE!. We came here just before sunset, although it was a very overcast day. It was really easy to navigate to the building and find the very short queue for bag check and the get the elevator up to the ?42nd floor. The views are basically 360 (a small portion blocked by a gift store) and even though overcast you could make out the silhouette of mt. Fuji! They also had little pictorial explanations of all the major buildings/sites so you could identify them. There is gift show with things from all the different regions of Japan and a bar which we had a beer at while waiting for it to become properly dark. The bar is pretty overpriced I think but the view is free so I can't complain!

Well worth a visit. Lovey place to visit and a short walk from Shinjuku station. You have a 360-degree view of Tokyo (on a reasonably clear day otherwise you will just see the fog and the mist). Entry is free which is a bonus. You can visit the north and the south towers going up to the 45th floor. After viewing and taking your photos, you can enjoy a light lunch or coffee whist enjoying the view. The grounds outside, and surrounding street offer exceptional photo taking opportunities of the famous Sky Scrapers.

Worthseeing if you have the time.. This is an impressive building with a very interesting forecourt. Plenty of photo opportunities. The queue to go up is not very long during weekdays and its one of the very few observation towers with free entrance. There are 2 souvenir kiosk on the observation floor selling good variety of things esp for kids. Don't eat at the restaurant on the observation deck. Go back down and get a visitor pass from security and make your way up to the 38th floor cafeteria via the main building elevators. All orders are done via vending machines after you preview the plastic sample dishes and food pick up at the different stalls. Cheap and good is how I would describe the menu. Lunch is before 2pm, after which only light meals.
Beautiful night time views of Tokyo. Go there for the late evening views of Tokyo tower for free. The building looks amazing in the evening too.

Great view...and it's free!. When you get inside the building, elevators are fast and free. At the top, there are a few vendors selling trinkets, but there is also a lovely cafe with comfortable seats and a limited menu. It was pretty hazy, so we could not see Mt. Fuji that day, but it offers a wonderful view over Tokyo. The courtyard out front of the building is a gorgeous space.

Free attraction - great view of the city. Free attraction where you can visit the observatory and get a 360 view of the city. Quite the view. Why pay to go up the Tokyo tower when you can see the city here!

Is all about the view / La vista lo es todo. Located about 4 blocks from Ogikubo Metro Station, this is a nice building that you can look meters before you arrive. On the 45th floor you will have a nice view of the city, it may not be the best, but is FREE./Localizado a unas 4 cuadras de la estación Ogikubo, y puedes distinguirlo casi saliendo del metro. en el piso 45 tendrás una manífica vista de la ciudad, tal vez no la mejor, pero es GRATIS! (Y gratis hasta las cachetadas)
It's free. Great views of Tokyo Saves on having to pay for the sky tree We went in the morning and then at dusk to see the sun setRemember it's completely free just turn up at reception on the day

Excellent viewing location with no admission fee.. While not as tall as the Skytree, this building still provided an excellent 360 degree view of Tokyo and surrounding areas. There was no cost to enter, so I was surprised that there were not more people taking advantage of this wonderful viewing platform.

Breathless view from top of Tokyo city office #TOKYO 100. I strongly recommend to visit top of metropolitan city office building when you have time during Tokyo stay from following reasons.1: 360 view around the region, incredible view2: Convenient location, central of Tokyo3: Free of charge!---------東京に来て滞在期間中、時間があった時に強くお勧めするのは、次の理由から都庁舎の最上階です。1: 首都圏の素晴らしい景色を360度楽しめる2: 東京の中心部で便利3: 最上階に上がるのは無料であること

Beautiful design.... Beautifully designed structure ; one of the more fascinating aspects is the satellite dishes at the top of each structure.Take advantage of the free observation point which is opened late.Within walking distance of Shinjuku Station.

Free Observation Deck- Saw Mt. Fuji. I submitted a review of the Tokyo Tower, and feel I need to compare it to the Metropolitan Government Office.The TMGO, first of all, is a free attraction. Visitors go to the bottom level of this building, and enter a line to an elevator. (I had difficulty finding this building. It's rather nondescript and in an area with many sky scrapers. I used a GPS to find it and was thankful I had it.Okay, so after a brief security check (searching through bags) you are allowed on the elevator, and travel up to the top. The views are really great, but you couldn't see the whole city (I mean, it's huge, right?)The best part was seeing Mt. Fuji!! I could not see it from the Tokyo Tower. Note that Mt. Fuji is not always visible- and we just were fortunate!The windows didn't seem as big as those in TT. There are thicker, more visible beams, and more people crowd around them. But hey- it's a free exhibit, so no complaints.There is a gift shop in the center, and a (sit down?) restaurant. These made it a bit harder to walk around the perimeter to see views.All in all, the views were really cool and I'm happy I went. If you're in the area, try to check this out.

Best views with no charge. The visit to the observation point totally worth it without having to fork out yen (me the cheapskate traveler)... Got the view of tokyo city though not 360degrees view.....Thus, don't miss the chance to visit the free observation point that the government building offer. There were souvenir shop at the same floor....

One of the best top views in Tokyo. Don't miss the chance to visit the free observation point that the government building offer. You'll have to wait a few minutes in line but it definitely worth it. It's not a 360 degrees view but almost. There's also a very cool souvenir shop at the same floor, but the whole city is a big shop by it self :)

I was lucky. I visited the Towers several times. Last time I was very lucky. We arrived just before sunset, and saw Fuji in the distance clearly above the clouds. The same morning I visited Fuji, but it was impossible to see it. So it was a real luck. Tokyo is very nice from above and after sunset it is even nicer.

Awesome birds eye view of Tokyo . When the sky is clear, you can see 360 degree panoramic view of Tokyo. Entry ans elevator ride is free. On the top there is an observatory deck, restaurant and gift shop.

Nice view from top but not much else. We went there at night 6/10/16. No charge fee and basically you just wait for the elevator and it will take you to floor 45. There are glass viewing panel but it was hard to take good picture due to reflection. There is a restaurant and couple gift shop.

Nice views . This is a very nice place to go to if you want to see Tokyo from the top floor of a sky scraper either day or evening time. If weather helps you have a lovely city view especially when sun goes down. Entrance is free and up there you can also find a lovely restaurant which is not as expensive as you may think and a couple of kiosks where you can get souvenirs and stuff like that. Overall it was a good experience and it's definitely worth visiting it!

Great view of tokyo. We waited in line for about 30 minutes and was ushered into an elevator that went to the 45th floor. The view was incredible! You could see all around the city. Lots of fun things to buy and a great place to meet other tourists and exchange places to visit

Super vIew. It's free, it's a fast elevator and the view from the 45th floor is amazing. One can see just how big is Tokyo. We did not expect the stores or the restaurant up there. But we should have.

Free entry to the Observation floors. A visit to the observation floors in this building (actually there are 2, and also a North and South tower, view is good from all) is a must-do when in Shinjuku - and it's free!

Excellent view of Tokyo and free. I was recommended to go here by a local after I mentioned I was planning to go to the Sky tree. I am glad I picked up on this recommendations, this place is open to about 11p.m every day and it is free to go in which Sky tree isn't. We got to the building around 7p.m, construction was taking place outside so we had to walk through some building works, as we got to the building we were met by a kind security guard who pointed us to bag search and then to the elevator to take us up to the top. It wasn't too crowded, this must be because not many tourists know about this place but tend to go for Skytree instead for a good view. At the viewing floor you can also find two small souvenir shops, the view is great and you have a good panoramic view over Tokyo. We stayed there for about an hour. This place is a short walk from Shinjuku station, about 7min walk (if you take the right exit). We ended up going here twice during our 4 day stay in Tokyo, once during the day and once during the evening to see all the lights.
A great free sight in Tokyo. Visited here as it was close to our hotel and it's a free and quick was to see Tokyo from above. There are also some great souvenir shops at the top too!
Nice city views. It's free observation deck with decent views of the city. the shop and restaurant are overpriced but other then that can't complain
A great view of the city. It's free and offers an amazing view over Tokyo, well worth it if you can make it and you're in Shinjuku

great views. Worth going to.Even with the cloud coverage on the day we visited we could still see a lot and it was good to go at the start of our time in Tokyo to give us an idea of the layout. We wanted to return for night viewing but ran out of time.Was good to have tourist information in the same building as well.

Free Observatory on the 45th Floor. There is a short wait for an express elevator ride to the observatory on the 45th floor. The weather determines how far one can see. In any case, views of the city can be had in all directions. Worth the time to get quick overview of this great city.

Free views!. There are many good places to see the city far up in Tokyo, but if you are traveling on low budget, this is is the place. Free entrance, and spectacular views from 42nd floor. Also easy to reach as it is quite close to Shinjuku station, a short walking distance.
Great sights! . Definitely recommend going to this place if you want to see Tokyo from a sky view for free! You can see all sides of Tokyo and it is absolutely Gorgeous! Definitely a must see!
Cool view of the city. How can you complain about a free viewpoint over the massive city of Tokyo. Lots of people but there was plenty of room to walk about.

Free city wide view. It's a fast escalator ride to the top of the government buildings and there are two to chose from, buildings not governments! We went on what started as a sunny clear day but went later in and the fog or cloud had rolled in so it didn't work so well, not the fault of the free service. So credit to the government building for offering this.
Magnificent View of Tokyo. Take time to go to the 45th floor of this building. The view across Tokyo are magnificent, particularly to Mt Fuji. It is free and well worth the visit

Freebie viewing. One of the Government towers is open to the public for fabulous views of the city. Open daily 9.30 - 11.00pm.An elevator whisks you up to the 45th floor to a 360 degree viewing area. There are a few souvenir shops and for those collecting the commemorative stamps a stamp desk.We went at night by metro, perfectly safe are to walk in and amazing views of Tokyo's lights.
Great views and it's free . Visited in the day and at night great views and it's free, two towers you can go up with a shop and restaurant.

Best view of Tokyo for free . The Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building actually offers two observation decks in each tower on the 45th floor (around 200m high). The North Observatory stays open until 10 pm. There's NO ENTRY FEE to go up and check the city out. They will check your bags for dangerous items before entering the elevator, though. Despite it being for free the line to get up was actually way shorter than for the Skytree. We visited Saturday or Sunday evening/night and waited only for about a quarter of an hour. If you want to see Tokyo as a whole or take stunning pictures, then this attraction is a must do! I recommend going there for the sunset. There's no time limit up on the platform as long as you're within their opening times. On a clear day you will be able to see iconic buildings such as the Tokyo Tower or the Skytree and even Mount Fuji!

Great view for free. Towards the end of our holiday and becoming dollar conscious so decided to visit and check out the view from the observation deck. The signage from the train station was very good which made it simple to locate. The view was great although I recommended trying to go when the pollution is low. Some good souvenirs at the observation level as well although they are fully priced. Very good family activity and you have to be happy about the cost.

The best free view in the city. The building is also known as Tocho. Come early here as there is a long queue. You can see as far as Mount Fuji in the clear day. Nearest station is Tochomae in Toei Oedo line, one stop from shinjuku. You can also walk from Shinjuku in underground passage which take around 15 min.
On your bucket list for sure. North tower and South towers great to visit. Also amazing courtyard out the front. Spectacular architecture
Great free view . The view from the top of the tower is excellent, it offers a 360 degree view from the tallest building in the area. Oh and it's free. Awesome

Good start. This is a great way to start your trip. Opens at 0930 and it's free. The view is incredibly and landmark well. Makes it easier to plan your day when you can see how far apart some of the main attractions are.
nice building for tourist. a must visit for tourists in japan because it will give you an idea on where else to go in Tokyo. Staff are very friendly and accommodating to any tourist inquiry.

Excellent views. We went to have a look in the south observation tower. It is free to enter and one tower is open until 11pm. Great 360 degree views of the city. The highlight is the very helpful and friendly volunteers who confidently tell if the history and facts about the city and buildings

A highly educational architectural building. We went as a family in April 2015. As soon as we came in, we had an English speaking tour guide who approached us and asked if we were interested in a free one hour tour. She was a soft spoken but very interesting and informative lady. We were shown parts of the towers which only tours could enter. It's worth a visit.

Great view! Free! Easy!. Our family visited here and it's a rather easy quick process. There was a small line at the bottom that moved very quickly, and an elevator ride up to the 50th floor. The views from there are spectacular and you can check out the entire 360° of Tokyo. There's a nice little restaurant and gift shop up top but we did not eat there. We were shocked that it was completely empty even during sunset. It's a lovely view of Tokyo and mt Fuji and amazing that it's free.
nice view and FREE. The view is good but the transport might be an issue. However, the sightseeing tower is free, so, no complain.
Seeing Tokyo. Very good view of Tokyo from 45th floor for free is a very good gift for tourist. Especially at night time the building is open up to 10 pm.

Amazing view . The view is simply spectacular! We had a joyful time trying to identify the tall buildings, cities sites that we have been and spotted the lovely home that we stayed in. Views are great for photography!

Free observatory deck. It used to be the highest building in Tokyo, around 90's, but not anymore. The highest building and observatory deck is skytree, around 450 meter, whilst this building is 200 meter. However visit to the observatory here is free.
Nice view! For free!!!. You get up to the observation decks by taking an elevator and it's quite easy to go there. You can catch a great view over large parts of Tokyo! For free!!
Excellent views for free!. Though the concrete building is not a beauty itself, the views from the 45th floor are amazing considering that the entrance is free!
Great free view. Free view from about 80 floors up. Open day (both towers) and evening (one tower). Reasonable priced restaurant upstairs as well as souvenir store.

Nice view from a free observation deck. This building houses the Tokyo Metropolitan government , which is sort of the city hall. With the exception of the observatory , all other areas are off limits to tourists.The buildings offers a very nice view from the free observation decks at a 45th floor (yes, there is an observation deck on each tower ), from which you can see the whole city surroundings. Too bad that the day I arrived , it was cloudy , though it is stated that on a clear day you could even see Mt Fuji.
View from the top is spectacular. The second building has a viewing area with a souvenir shop and coffee area. Great views - well worth the tie there
Nice views. Was a little foggy when we went up, but still lovely views. Not as tall as the Tkyo Sky Tower, so if u want amazing views, go there.

Free observation area at the top. We visited one of the two towers on a Thursday around noon. At the elevator area to get the observation area there is a basic security check of your backpacks and large bags. There are no admission fees. Groups of 8 to 10 go up at a time. We waited for about five minutes before reaching the front of the line. At the top you can get panoramic views of Tokyo. There are a cafe, a souvenir shop with various regional specialties, and free bathrooms. To come down you enter another elevator line. Again, we didn't have to wait long. I would say this free alternative is probably as good as some of the towers with admission fees.
Great views . Took a lift up to the top on a tour the veiws where fantastic and worth a look it goes on for ever the veiw the veiwing area goes right around the builing amazing

Good below , Great at the Top. About a 10 minute walk from Shinjuku Station and free ride in the elevator to the Observation Deck where the views are great , some Excellent souvenirs and a Great Café. I hate heights but the way this is set out, I felt very comfortable. If your in Tokyo or Shinjuku itself , don`t miss it. Also there are guided tours done by English speaking volunteers...................

Free 360-degree view of the city. There is free access to a viewing deck with floor-to-ceiling windows. We went on a Friday night, and had a very short wait to go up. You can essentially walk around the whole building on the observation floor and view the city in all directions. Really nice!

Free. If you're oldschool anime fans you might remember this building. It's famous because it was featured in anime called X by Clamp. And Yes it's free. This building has 2 observatory and both of them are free. If you visit this building on sunny and bright day, you could see fuji from far away. They also have shops and restaurant in the observatory level. The train station is right under the building and the shinjuku park is just right across it.
Best views. Just the best views of Tokyo, for free! The lift journey is a rush and the views stunning in the day and at night. Brilliant!

Skyline view of Tokyo . Highly recommend a trip up the top of the Tokyo government building in shinjuku. There is a north and a south tower, both side by side, the north gives a view of Mount Fuji but you have to be very lucky with the weather.if it's too sunny it's too hazy to see. Both towers are free of charge to go up and look around, both suitable for small kids and or people in wheelchairs as the viewing points are low enough. There is a coffee shop at the top which services wine/beer/tea/coffee and very reasonable priced shopping. The shopping is all various Japanese food and drinks great for gifts and there's another souvenir shop which has the usual magnets/key rings etc. I prefer these towers to the skytower, that's personal preference and the fact it's free you've nothing to lose.
Free and fun. Excellent views for free. We couldn't see Mt. Fuji when we went as it was still too foggy, but the views of the city were so fun to look down at and examine. Would recommend for anyone.

Fantastic views of Tokyo. Free entry and amazing views of Tokyo from all directions makes this place a must see. The building is the second tallest in Tokyo and the observatories (there are two on each side, North and South) sit at about 200 metres high. There are maps in the observatory explaining what some of the nearby landmarks and buildings are and I'd recommend visiting the cafe for a coffee/lunch as there are views from here too and the prices are reasonable. A great way to see Tokyo from up high.

Great views and an enjoyable time with wonderful photo opportunities. Our hotel was located near by and they suggested a visit to the Government office for a view from their observation floors. We were not disappointed. There are two towers, both offering a subtly different view of Tokyo, The thing that I found surprising was that the facility is well managed, there a plenty of visitors, and there were no charges levied. Each deck, had shopping experiences, some that were interesting and some kitsch. If you are nearby, certainly worth the visit.

Great views and free, too!. Our group visited the south tower during the day and the north tower during the night since we wanted to experience both views. It would be really hard to pick the "better" one since they were totally different. If at all possible, I'd recommend going twice like we did.Both times the wait was almost nonexistent, which was a pleasant surprise. In a city where most things can get pricey, I'd definitely recommend taking advantage of this free offering.

It's just free!!! But please check my comments before your visit on weekends.. I visited Tokyo metropolitan obserbatry on last sunday with my family.I was surprised many travelers came from so many countries.But lot of travelers got lost the entrance of tower.And they asked us where the entrance was or the obserbatry should be opened.So I should post this comment in tripadviser."Tokyo metropolitan obserbatly should be opened on every weekends,and you should enter from 1st(Ground) floor's entrance"And For all travelers, I wish,"Have good trips and enjoy in Japan "

From this building you can see Tokyo and the volcano. It's free to go up .a magnificent building. The lifts are an experience. I went up in the afternoon and after dark. Unbelievable.if there had been a charge to go up I would have not seen Tokyo at night time.

" Wonderful Views of Tokyo for Free ". My family went too the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office which offers free views of Tokyo. There are 2 towers: North and South. The North Tower has better views, and is also open at night if you want to get away from the crowds in the morning and see the night lights of Tokyo. There is a security check at each point of entry to the elevators, so have your bags ready for inspection. On the 45th floor of each tower there is observatories for you to see out of. The observatories each have a shop and restaurant. On a clear day you can see Mt. Fuji. A great way to save some money, and get a wonderful view of the large city of Tokyo. This building is a must see !

Awesome view. The view from the observation deck is wonderful and it is free or charge. You can access the elevator to the observation deck from floor 1. If you are hungry, I recommend going for a lunch at the cafeteria, rather than eating at the coffee in the observation area. To reach the cafeteria (floor 32) you need to sign in at level 2 and get a visitor pass. The food was tasty, affordable and can be enjoyed with a great view.

A free skyline view, well worth a visit. If you want to save some money and the trip up the skytree this is the place for you. Great view from the top and no charge at all to visit. The viewing area is quite large and should you want a drink and a chance to sit then there is a nice bar also at the top.

Fantastic view of Tokyo -- for free!. This is one place you can get a scenic view of Tokyo (and even a clear view of Mt Fuji on a clear day) for free! There are 2 towers but we only managed to go to the North one. The South tower closes early most days, so check the timings online before going.
Amazing views. The views from the 45th floor are increíble. And its free. Theres a restaurant on the top floor in case you wsnt to grab a bite. 530 pm is the last elevator up.

Great free activity. I was alone trying to find nearby things to check out and this was great. The people were friendly and helped me figure out where to go. There was no wait when I went and the views were great. Didn't spend too much time there but was worth the trip.
Free View of City. Go to the Tokyo Metropolitan Govt Building to get a great view of the downtown Tokyo. Best time would be around sunset.Best part - It's FREE !

It's free!!😃. Open 7days and its free. Wow!!
Great view with coffee shop and toy shop for your entertainment.
Bag check at desk before elevators is all that is required and you are in!

Great view of the city and It's free!. Don't need to go to Tokyo Skytree to see the whole city. Was cloudy so wasn't able to catch Mount Fuji in a distance. Staff cafe at North Tower 32th floor is worth checking out. Opens from 11.30am to 3pm I think. A glimpse of how locals eat at work. Cheap food too. Good experience.
Great views. Take the elevator to the free observation deck and you will be rewarded with great panaromaic views over Tokyo.
Great view of Tokyo without the hassle!. Had a great visit, super helpful staff, definitely worth it vs. the Tokyo Skytree which was a lot of hassle and very expensive!

Nice view for free. The visit was really nice, try to arrive early because depending on the period you might have some queues to go up. We arrived early so it was very fast to get there in the 45 floor, but when we left the building the queue was a bit longer.You don't need to pay to go up, this is the good thing. There is a restaurant/cafe where you can see another side of the building but this is only allowed if you have something in the restaurant, I haven't joined so I don't know if the view would be better from this side of the floor.In the neighborhood of this building you can find many other buildings and the Love sign which is nice to take some pictures.

Spectacular view. We had some spare time between the museum visits at Tokyo. I don't even know how that is eaven possible to have spare time in Tokyo! Anyway. We head our ways to Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office building. I think we went to the south entrance. Short inspection of our backpacks and to the elevator. Elevator took some time to get us to the top that was floor 45. The view was breath taking even thou there are higher places nearby. Good thing was that it didn't cost anything to get there. Although the souvenir shop and cafe were nicely priced. Tip: You should take a try for Yokohama Landmark Tower Sky Garden as well. Another similar place to go if you are near by there.

Great skyline view and it's free!. I accidentally stumbled across this sky view when looking for the tourist information centre. The view makes you flabbergasted at the populated housing as far as your eye can see. That's all it has.

Amazing view!. Free view over Tokyo.My friends and I visited this place twice, during daytime and during the night. We also witnessed the sunset, which was gorgeous!A definite must if you ever find yourself in Tokyo.

Free view over Tokyo. Why pay for a view when you can get one for free? Only problem at night (it's open until 10:30pm) is the bright lights inside make it difficult to see out through the reflective glass. One drawback: no outdoor viewing area.

The No1 free thing in Japan. Skip the lines and the payment at the other towers and come here for a free unobstructed view of the whole Tokyo Metropolitan Area. When I was there on a hot sumemrs day, you could see all the way up to Mount Fuji. The access is a bit difficult to find but ask around and people will shw you to the main entrance. My visit was on a Saturday so there was a queue but its manageable.

Awesome views. We decided to go to the observation tower in this building as there are no queues. We were not disappointed. There is a coffee shop ( Starbucks style) on the ground floor while waiting for the tower to open. We went up to the 45th floor. There are two towers North and South. We did both and went back again for the night views. On a clear day you can see Mt Fuji unfortunately there was a cloud over it for us.! There are souvenir gift shops at the top of both towers. This attraction is also free admission. The towers are only a 5 min walk from Shinjuku Washington Hotel.
Great Place to view Mt Fuji. If you're in Tokyo for a few days wait until the sky is clear and head to the observation deck for an excellent view of Mt Fuji. Free and a must do in Tokyo...

Great free 360 view of Tokyo. This is a great way to get a grip on the sheer size of Tokyo. You can look in all directions and it's open from morning until the late evening. At night there is a lot of inside light which makes this place less useful for taking nighttime pictures. Also no tripods or monopods are allowed but the windows all have a windowsill to put your camera on. If you are in the neighbourhood or you're not willing to pay the huge fees of the Sky tree or Tokyo tower then this is a great free viewpoint.

Nice view and free of charge. if you've time, don't miss this 'free of charge' spot - visit the observatory floor of the government office at Shinjuku. it opens until evening, and it's great view over the city.
Lovely view. especially when sunset. it is free and we can enjoy the outstanding view of Tokyo from 200-metre high

Great views over Tokyo. This is the only observatory that I know of in Tokyo that is free. You get a great 360 view over the city. It is a little bit out of town, but you can visit the Camera district while you are in the area. I would recommend this definitely as a priority.

Don't bother with Tokyo Tower. Okay, maybe not as tall, but it's close to it and it's free!180 view is available, I managed to see Fuji on a semi clear day, and ITS FREE.You may have to wait in a line, but usually only takes max. 10 minutes. The area surrounding the building is beautiful too, nice park, lots of trees etc. A good 20 min walk from Shinjuku station but definitely suggest for travellers who move away from tourist traps and love a good view.

A great free view. Architecture reminded me of KL's Petronas Towera and the view from 45th floor over Tokyo is great. Go after 5, take your time and watch sun set and city come alive with neon. Best free view around. Avoid the bar - cover charge for view and the music. Plenty of great value bars to people watch on ground - and underground - levels.

The best Free view in Tokyo. The Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office was only two blocks away from Shinjuku Chuo Park and Kumano Shrine, so we were able to see multiple free attractions rather quickly. We visited on a work day (Wednesay) in the early afternoon so there were no lines for the elevator and it was not crowded in the building. We easily took the elevator to the North Observatory on the 45th floor after a minor security bag check and were able to view a breathtaking views of the entire city, which expanded as far as the eye could see. We did not explore the first and second floor in depth before heading up, but did see Tourist Information Shops that had many brochures with English speaking staff that were helping other tourists plan out other visits. These little shops also had free food samples of local dishes, which was pretty cool. It was a pretty clear day but we weren’t able to see Mt. Fuji unfortunately. Regardless, the view was incredible. There were also cool shops up there selling many local toys, gadgets, etc. and a café so we took a little time to shop around for small Japan Trinkets before heading out. It was a short and cost-free trip that was very enjoyable. Highly recommended for those who are staying close and are able to access it easily/with minimal travel costs. Even with the add-ons of the park being close by, I would not recommend spending a large amount of money to transport here to see the views. It was incredible but not worth at 30 dollar cab ride to see.
FREE VIEWS. Great views of Tokyo and its FREE! On a clear day, Mt Fuji can be seen, but unfortunately when we visited in Sept 16, we couldn't see it due to clouds.

High view of Tokyo. From the top of each tower you can enjoy the view of Tokyo.On a nice morning you can spot Mt Fuji, and in the evening you will enjoy the twinkling lights of the city after a sunset.It's a little walk from Shinjuku station, and it's free. You are most likely to wonder if you're not lost until you exit the station. Just follow the english signs in the station.The super fact elevator will make your ears pop ;)Cheers

Great views across Tokyo. This mammoth structure has an observation deck on the 45th floor which gives you uninterrupted views across Tokyo and it is only at this point that I realised how huge the city was. On a clear day you can see Mt. Fuji, but for me she was covered up! It's free, the queues to get in weren't long and the height afforded some good picture opportunities.
Nice architecture . Very high building with a nice design. The area is full of skyscrapers and such. It's interesting for people into cosmopolitan areas

Spectacular!. What a view! Its free observation decks provide beautiful panoramic views of Tokyo and beyond. The observatory has a cafe and a souvenir shop. The North Observatory remains open later at night, making it a popular spot to catch night views of the city, which I totally recommend! If I remember correctly it's in the West side of Shinjuku station, but you can't miss it anyway... The elevator ride lasts exactly 55 seconds as the elevator lady said. Perfect Japanese precision! A definite To Do on your Tokyo bucket list.

A free view of Tokyo. Although I visited the Tokyo Skytree, I went to Metropolitan Government Office (North building) in the evening. The view is spectacular and you will definitely enjoy it. They provide a free wifi so you can FaceTime your friends at home and share the view with them!Night view is amazing but here is a tip: place your phone directly on the window glass (flash off) and you will have amazing photos, guaranteed. There are two souvenir shops with a good selection of things and the prices are really good.So, when you add all this up and that the entrance is free, make sure you have it on your list when in Tokyo.

Nice free observation deck. We stayed at a hotel directly across the street from this building and visited the free enclosed observation deck. The views are excellent and the observation deck includes a nice shopping area where we purchased some souvenirs. The staff was friendly and the elevators were very efficient.

Free is always good. Went up to 45 th floor and got a good view of Shinjuku in Tokyo. There is no charge to go up to 45 th floor. They do check your backpack , purse when you go up. It takes 55 seconds to get up there. There are gift shops and a restaurant on that floor. You can enjoy the view while you eat and drink. Bathroom is on the 44 th floor so you have to walk down one floor. Also smoking room is on the same floor. Please take advantage of the tourist information desk downstairs they are eager to assist visiting guests. Good luck and enjoy the view.

Japan in 7 days. Day 6 Part 22. The Tokyo Metropolitan Government office is located to the west of the enormous Shinjuku station. It is our second time to visit this free attraction. The first one in 2010 was at night. This time it was late afternoon and we were hoping to see Mt. Fuji.You can see the different buildings and districts to view on the labels placed on the windows. The Tokyo tower can be seen. Also, the Shinjuku area. Once again, Mt. Fuji was hiding behind the clouds. I still took a zoomed picture of the area where it was supposed to be. Once I got home, a Photoshop magic tool on the picture, revealed the mountain. Its top 10 percent can be seen. Tip: There was a comprehensive bird's eye high definition video showing in the souvenir section. This was definitely better to watch than trying to figure out the buildings outside.

Take the free tour. We took the free guided tour to see this building.It's an impressive building, and hard to believe a Government building can be so well run.They show you around the building, and explain you a bit about the functioning of the Government.The tour ends on the observatory, where you get sweeping views of the city.A good way to experience the skyscrapers of Tokyo.
Great Free Attraction. The best view from the city for free is from here. It's about a ten minute walk from Shinjuku station. If you're hungry, there's also a restaurant on top.

Feels like Empire State Building in NYC. We went on a Friday. No real long line ups but still lots of people nevertheless. Well worth a trip up. Take lots of pictures. Souvenirs are a bit pricey but hey you got in for free!

A good place to see the city of Tokyo from a skyscraper. Free to go up and see the city of Tokyo. At the top, there are various products from various cities in Japan, even Fukushima. They were selling Fukushima food items.

It's free!!!. Nothing beats free views over Tokyo! Easy to get to and definitely worth making the effort. There is an underground underpass from Shinjuku Station West Exit that goes directly here. Do it.

Fantastic views for free. Well worth a visit, especially since it's free! We went at sunset and it was great to watch Tokyo lighting up. Super fast lift whisks you up to the observation decks on the 45th floor, it was quite crowded when we visited and we had to queue for the lift and shuffle around with the crowds around the windows. It's also difficult to get decent photos as there is a glare from the bright lighting. We had problems finding the entrance as we walked from the Washington hotel and didn't realise we needed to go underneath the road at the front of the main building.

Free English speaking guide. The view from the observation deck is spectacular. Its 55 seconds to the top.. 45 th floor.. Where the observation deck is. As we reached there we were gladly surprise and happy to accept free services of an English speaking guide. He identified all the buildings for us and told us about Tokyo. As foreign tourists this was a very welcome service. The souvenir shop on the north tower does not accept cards. Only cash. There is a loo up there. And the restaurant is also pretty good. Though everything is expensive and you even pay for hot water. The fact that it's free makes it a really worthwhile place to go. We'll connected from shinjuku station. Walkable.
Fantastic view of Tokyo. From the observatory deck i. 45th floor, you can see Tokyo. If you're lucky you also can see Mt. Fuji. You can also can buy souvenir here with reasonable price.

Tokyo Metropolitan Building . Wow, the government building is so big and high :) surrounded by large pedestrian when we walk to it. And at the observation area at the top we can see Tokyo from above. Great place to see Tokyo

Tokyo from above. Perfect place to see Tokyo from above and its for free. I advice to see it in the late afternoon.The North tower is open h9- 21.Closed 2nd and 4nd monday of every month.Sud tower open 9.30 - 17.30. closed 1 and 3 thursday.

Why not? It's a great view of Tokyo if you are in the area anyway.. We did the Government Building immediately after arriving, partly due to its proximity to our hotel (Hilton). If you are within walking distance and have the time, it's a great view of Tokyo.

great views no cost. This is a public building and was very busy when we went in jan of 2016, travel up to the observation deck to see over the city and have views of mt fuji. there are nice little shops to buy souvenirs. we purchased tea and some hello kitty items for the kids.

Good view ruined by bright lighting. It is free and we didn't have to wait for the lift. However we went at night to get good views and found the bright internal lighting meant it wasn't possible to take photos or really see very much at all.

Excellent local knowledge shared. Great views from the South Tour. We were even approached by a ridiculously friendly local volunteer and she explained us through each section of the floor, looking out the windows. We learned lots of interesting facts and new places to visit during our holiday.
Local products to purchase at reasonable prices too.

Great view. It's free and gives a nice view of Tokyo. Unfortunately it was a cloudy, a bit rainy day so we were not able to see Mt. Fuji. But anyway, a good place for sightseeing.
If I remember correctly, the south terrace closes at 17 and north at 22.

Best view of Tokyo. This is free and gives a great view of the Tokyo skyline. We did not have to queue for very long and the elevator takes 1 minute to get to the viewing area. A gift shop and restaurant are on the same floor as the observation deck if you want to take advantage. East to get to from the Shinjuku station.
June 2014. Beautiful structure. Beautiful view of the town. We just happened to go on a cloudy day so couldnt clearly see Mt Fuji but still an amazing view of the city!

Free Views of the City. We stayed at a hotel that was right across the street from the Metro building so, we decided since it was free to go up, we could not pass this up. We went up the North Tower at night with no problems. It was a beautiful view of the city and our first experience in Tokyo. We did not go up during the day but, I think on a clear day, you could probably see beyond the city.

Amazing view for free!. Went here two times, once in the morning and once just before the closing time (on July it was 11PM) and I have to say I loved it both times. The view is amazing and it is free! It's really easy to reach thanks to all the directions starting at the Shinjuku station.Be careful cause when I went with my mother she felt dizzy once we got up because the elevator is really fast!

OK View but not great.. This review is for the North tower. It was in the evening and the South tower was closed. Apparently the South tower has the better view.There was a long line up to take the elevator up but it moved pretty quickly. There will also be a long line up to take the elevator down which again is pretty quick.The view is OK but the viewing area is not the best. The circular area is occupied in the middle by souvenir and gift stands. Another one-third of the window area is occupied by a restaurant that has window seating. Therefore you cannot access this area. The remaining two-thirds of the area is for viewing but it is chopped up by pillars and walls.Another detraction is that the entire area is lighted so you have a difficult time seeing out the window because of all the glare from the lights. If you visit in the evening, you need to stick your face right up to the glass and put your hands around your eyes to see anything.

Scraping the skies. You'll love it here if:- you fancy a magnificent view of Tokyo with Mt Fuji (富士山) in the background, free of chargeReconsider if:- you've been up Tokyo Tower or SKYTREEStaff are available to guide you to the observatory. A lift takes you up to a floor where there are a couple of souvenir shops and a restaurant, and here you are given a bird eye's view of Tokyo's city view in all its glory. There are even boards which inform you of the various landmarks in front of you, such as SKYTREE and Mt Fuji.Note that if you want the best view, it's probably wiser to go when the weather isn't cloudy, otherwise you won't be seeing much of the mountains in the background. Also there is a tourist information center at the first floor with plenty of helpful brochures for traveling in Tokyo and other prefectures in Japan.If you plan to walk there, you may want to check out the LOVE sculpture located nearby; it's a popular meeting spot for couples (though nowadays Hachiko in Shibuya is gaining traction). Of course it's also the perfect place to go wild with your camera.
Great free view of Fuji!!. We found that this was best to do on a clear morning and really enjoyed the free observatory experience.
Great views for free. There are lots of buildings with great views, but you have to pay. Here you can see Tokyo at its best. It's a circular terrace with a wonderful views. We visit it at night

Stunning View!. We went in through the main entrance to the building, but the staff were nice enough to show us how to get to the observation tower with no difficulty. We went up the North Side tower, which boasts a great view all round. There are a few small shops in the towers, but as probably expected, they aren't the cheapest of places to get souvenirs.
Astonishing sight. Went up to the North Tower, the tallest, enjoying a fantastic sighr over Tokyo. Moutn Fuji was clouded so just saw the base, everything else was excellent.
A must to visit. This one is the place you must visit in Tokyo. Best view in the city free of charge. Go there when the weather is fine, not too cloudy.

a 360 view of the city that's hard to beat!. We visited the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office on our last day in Tokyo and we really enjoyed our visit. The trip to the 45th floor is completely free and offers stunning views of the city. It should be on everyone's visit list when in the city. While we were there in August 2016, there was a Japanese local food exhibit which we enjoyed exploring too.
For the views. It's a building that one goes to for the 45th floor views... we went to the north tower... wasn't much but better going in the evenings to spot anything.

Great views, crowded and touristy. Being across the street from my hotel, I finally went to the observation deck on a Sunday early morning. There was a large queue of Chinese tourists in front but we all got into the elevator eventually. They did not air condition the lift and the observation deck therefore it was stuffy and claustrophobic. GREAT views, snap snap and leave asap before you melt. The cafe wasn't open and the rest were tacky souvenir shops

The views!. You can see the city and beyond from the 45th floor. I love the fact that it's accessible and free of charge. There were interesting Japanese items at reasonable prices (for example, teas, crackers/biscuits, incense, etc.) in the "boutique" which is located on the same floor.Worth a visit.

Excellent views of Tokyo. This building is seen from the front view from Keio Plaza Hotel. Entrance is difficult to locate under the flyover. Excellent views of Tokyo particular at night. Yes ts FREE!!!!

Amazing view at night. We were there twice - once just after opening and once at night. We much prefered this place at night the view is spectacular. We didnt wait for more than three minutes and it was for free. There is also bar/restaurant to enjoy meal or drink with the view, but just sest fee was at about 1000 yen/person - there was a jazz band on tuesday.

Great free view. Hard to find the entrance - head to the lower street level, under the flyover - but once we got there is was a great way to get a sense of the vast size of Tokyo. Excellent at sunset and night. And free!
Great views. Good views on a clear day. Can be pretty hazy though. Even with the haze its good to go up since its free.

Opposite view from Keioplaza. You can see building from Keioplaza room it's great, i don't know this place before when i come to hometown watch youtube channel. The 45th floor of building you can enjoy a sweeping view of tokyo from 202 meters from ground.

A great way to see Tokyo. Going to the observation floor is free and gives a wonderful view of how expansive Tokyo is. There is not much point going on a day that is very cloudy, but it is fine if there are just a few clouds in the sky.There are times you need to wait to get the elevator, but I have never had to wait much more than 10-15 minutes.

Free is a very good price. The best thing about this building as compared to the many other skyscrapers in Tokyo is that it's free and gives you a nearly 360 degree view (you'd need to visit both towers to get the full 360). There is a little food and some beverages available at the top, but no required purchase. The seating at the cafe area is far from the windows, though, which is why I'm only rating it a 4 instead of 5. I'm sure if you could see more from the eating area, there would be a lot of people buying a croissant and sitting there for hours... Too bad because I would gladly keep buying food and/or drinks to sit there and enjoy the view.

2 Free Observation Decks. Excellent View of Tokyo. Also Free to enter. Your bag is searched as a condition of entry similar to Tokyo sky tree.The entry point to access the towers can be hard to find. Also the observation decks have different hours to the rest of the building.

Ok for free but limited views . I have given this 4* as its a free attraction and worth a visit. Views are good where you can actually see, but the viewing observatory is blocked off on approx 1/3 of the whole place unless you are eating in the restaurant so if you want proper 360 views of the city then look elsewhere.

amazing view for free. view from 45th floor. amazing view.there are few shops there and a restaurant. just great. in any country in the world it wouldn't be free. the staff here is helping and welcoming.
nice view from the 40 floor of the building. The Tokyo Government Buildings is worth visiting, has free entrance and nice panoramic view on the city from 202 mt height from the observatory.

Good vantage point over Tokyo. Easy on the pockets!. We visited this for a birds eye view over Tokyo area. The building was easy to find and clearly signposted from the train and metro stations. The observatory didn't do much for me and I think the one at Tokyo skytree might potentially offer a better view. However entry here is free and it is much easier to get to being in shinjuku where you can make this a pit stop and continue on with other activities in the same area. Only worth a one time visit.

What's not to like about this?. It's hard to beat two towers with observation decks on the 45th floor that's free. There are gift shops on top and plenty of signage so you know what you're seeing out the various windows. You enter the elevators from the lower level (there's a down escalator when you first walk in the door) and exit on the second floor (which is the floor you entered the building on).

Best free place to view city. The architecture of the building itself is worthy. However, it's claim to fame is it's free (in fact, two free) observation decks at the top of each tower. And with almost no line and no hassle to go up either. And convenient to get to.Great for a budget traveller or a time-crunched traveller. Or in my case, since it was very cloudy outside anyway and so not a great view, I didn't feel like paying for the Tokyo Tower (with nearly the same height) or especially paying for the Skytower.
great view, free. easy to find and only a short walk from Shinjuku. you can see very far and almost all directions. best of all: it is free!

Free and open late!. I'm not sure why it says the observation desk is open until 18:45 on trip advisor as when I went 5 days ago it is open until 23:00 with the last entry at 22:30. Anyway, the observation area is 100% Free to go up and it is a completely worthwhile activity to do. If you really want to enjoy an evening there why not go to the restaurant on the observation floor and overlook Tokyo at night!

Great view. A place where you can go without a fee. There are actually two blocks but we went to the one where we can see Mount FujiThe staff is very helpful at the reception and it was not very packed.The best part is that we are able to see Mount Fuji and the whole of Tokyo city. A worthwhile place to go.

Great view. Definitely the best way to get a good view of the city of Tokyo. We went on a saterday and it wasnt very crowded. Easy to reach by metro, and totally free to go up. You can choose between two buildings, or pick them both. Plus, they're selling cool gadgets at the top of the building!
Awesome view. Visited in December and went to the viewing gallery. It's worth a visit for the views of Tokyo and it's free to get into too! Win.
Great view of Tokyo. About 5mins walk from my hotel, great view of Tokyo Skyline. On top there's a restaurant and places to buy sounevirs.A must see when in Tokyo.

Great Spot on a Clear Day. We took our chances going up on a hazy day and it was a nice opportunity to see the area. Tokyo doesn't have as impressive a skyline as New York or Paris, but it was worth the stop. Surprisingly, the shops on the observation deck level were lovely with specialty products. Mt. Fuji is shy so you may miss it even on a mostly clear day.

Free...ish. Went to the 45th floor on a Friday night but it wasn't too busy. It's free to go up but the best views are from a restaurant area with high prices and a 500¥ cover charge. Expect the usual souvenir stalls all of which are very brightly lit which means there is a lot of reflection off the windows if you visit at night - makes photos difficult & makes seeing distant views difficult too! I understand that these are the things that make this attraction financially viable, but I'd have preferred to pay and be able to get a 360° view that was subtly lit.

North tower observation deck. Went to see the view from the north tower observation deck, view is great: skytree, cocoon tower, tv tower, etc
Windows could use cleaning, issue for photos, tripod allowed

Amazing views of Tokyo for FREE!. This is a great, a free attraction which gives 360 degree views of Tokyo, as far as Mt Fuji (if clear). There are 2 towers which are both open 6 days a week. 2 elevators take you to the top floor after a typically ordered queue of a few minutes. Great views from the observation deck and there is also a small cafe and gift shop for souvenirs.

Great views of Toyko. The Metropolitan Government Building was directly opposite our hotel. We took a trip up to the 45th floor for spectacular views of Tokyo. Entrance is free. There are great boards located at the viewing windows explaining the buildings, parks etc that you are looking at in each area. Its definitely worth a visit. Unfortunately we did not see Mt Fuji as it was too hazy at the time.

Free view of the city. We turned up in the early evening and went to the top within 15 minutes. The view is from behind glass and is obviously entirely dependent on the weather. On a clear day apparently you can see Mt. Fuji but we were not so lucky.Not the best viewing platform in the world but it's free unlike any other similar views in foreign cities, and it made a good first night introduction to Tokyo. Convenient for anyone in the Shinjuku area.

View for free if you can find it. We went here for night views and as long as you don't need to make pictures too much, you cannot get better views for free. Once you find the building from Ueno station (look for small blue signs in English) it's an easy elevator ride up and you can enjoy great views in all directions. the night time views were really cool, it's a completely different city at night.

Spectacular. Went on Wednesday morning to the South Tower. No queue and went straight up to the South Observatory Tower. We were lucky enough to have a volunteer English speaking guide to point out different points of interest and history behind the buildings etc. It was not a clear day so Mount Fuji could not be seen. Had an expensive cup of tea and coffee at the cafe. Considering the viewing is free I suppose it didn't hurt as much to pay 500 yen for a cuppa. Go weekdays to avoid the crowd and if you are lucky you might also have the free service of a guide.

Go to the top, see the city!. Free trip to the top of the government offices will give you a 360 degree view of tokyo and although busy with people, is a great way to orient yourself with the city and take in the scope and size of Tokyo.
On a fine day you can see Mt Fuji. Visit the 46th floor obsevratory in the North or South Tower and you will have a wonderful view of Tokyo

Tokyo Skyline for free. Awesome views over the City Skyline for free.If you're staying or visiting,or travelling through Shinjuku District, this is only a short walk from the Train Station, & the brightly lit streets. Its a Government building which stays open until 2300 every evening, entrance 1 floor below.We went twice , daytime & evening
Free viewing of Tokyo. We nixed our plan of visiting the Tokyo tree and Tokyo tower after visiting this place.. Free viewing of Tokyo.. Can't get any better than that!!

Free to visit. Free to visit and open all week - even Sunday's. Make sure you queue up on the lowest level - not the Main Street entrance. Good views but part is cut off by the restaurant, Good View. It is free though

Great view of the lights of Tokyo. . Great view of the lights of Tokyo. You need to buy a drink at the bar or restaurant if you want to see the Shinjuku side of Tokyo.
Free wifi at the top. :)
Great Views. The best part is it is free ! Apart from that, the views of Tokyo (especially at night ) are spectacular. Walking distance from Shinjuku Station. Do yourself a favour and experience it !

Free to visit and incredible views. Amazing panoramic views of the
Tokyo from 45 floors up. The elevator takes 55 seconds and it is so lovely that it's free to do! We went in both the day nd the night so we could see Tokyo lit up also

Great views over the city and beyond. Being travellers on a budget and Having read other reviews about the Government towers, we decided to give this a shot. We were not disappointed. There is a 360 degree view of the whole of Tokyo and it's free! The view is spectacular and on a clear day, you can just about make out Mt. Fuji. Slightly crowded but you can't really grumble when a free attraction is so good. Would definitely consider this option over paying to go up the more commonly visited skytree.

Nice view for free.. The place is really nice. You can walk from Shinjuku Station or take a metro directly to Tochomae Station and then enter into Building 1. There's a tourist center on the lobby floor where you can grab some brochures and maps. The staffs were so nice and polite. The observatory on the 45th floor is opened to public for free. The building itself is taller than other buildings i the area so you can see the view of Tokyo from here. You can see all Tokyo Tower, Tokyo Skytree and Tokyo Bay. The only flaw is that each window is separated, like usual office building, not a panorama-long window.

The two towers. Just to add, you will be faced with a choice: north tower or south tower. Choose the south. Definitely. The north has a cafe blocking 1/3 of the view. The south's cafe is in the center, allowing unobstructed panoramic views. Plus you can see Yoyogi Park and Imperial Palace, Tokyo Bay.

A nice night view from above. An easily accessible tourist spot from Shinjuku JR Station where you could overview the skyline of the wider Tokyo city. Be prepared that it'll be crowded at night and it takes some time to wait for the lift to go downstairs. Anyway, the lift takes you only 55 seconds to reach the observatory on the 45th floor.

amazing views for free!. A beautiful building located in the middle of the city. Main draw would be the free observatory decks located in the south & north towers. South more for day while North opens a bit later good for night views.Great views from either one of them. With favorable weather conditions one can view Mount Fuji, the Tokyo Skytree, Tokyo Tower, Meiji Shrine and the Tokyo Dome. I was lucky enough to see Fuji-san during sunset. It does get crowded so you have to plan to spend some time to grab that ideal shot. The deck also has a cafe & souvenir shop.Definitely worth a stop for both the day & night view. Being free there isn't any excuse not to pop over. Highly recommended.
Amazing view for free. If u go on weekends the tower has about a 2minute line. The view is great and gives a different perspective to the skytree and tokuo tower
Great view of Tokyo from the 45th Floor. If you want a panoramic view over Tokyo, go to the viewing platform on the 45th floor of the TMG. Easy to find from Shinjuki Station - and it is free.

Amazing city view!. A free observatory at 200 meters where we can have a panoramic view of the city of Tokyo and beyond. You could be luck and see Mount Fuji from here. It is in Shinjuku with free entrance and you have to pass by a control service. So you should not take big suitcases. We can go from 9h30am to 11pm. Take the 1st floor of the main building to access the deck observatory. You will have information of what you are seeing and you have useful guides. Take your camera to save this amazing view of the city, and choose where and what to visit in Tokyo!
Free and great view of Tokyo. Easy access via JR rail. Bit of walk but not too bad from station. Helpful staff. Worth a visit for sure for a great view and holiday snaps.

Free Observatory. There are a lot of observation platforms in Tokyo but this is probably the best value because it is absolutely free. The Touchou was the tallest building when it was built in Tokyo but it has been surpassed by other buildings and structures (Yokohama Landmark Tower for example and SkyTree). Nevertheless, it is free when the other observatories charge fees.From the east exit of Shinjuku Station we went straight out through the underground pedestrian passage (nice on the return leg since it started to rain) and just followed the signs to the Touchou or Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office. I believe we exited at A4, went through the nearest doorway, passed through security, and took the first tower closest to us. There is a North and South Tower and I think we went to the North one (we also passed a tourist information center on the way in).We took the designated express elevator, which takes less than a minute, to the top and then saw nice views all around us. From various viewppoints, we saw the Tokyo Tower, Skytree and many other landmarks. Since it was overcast we did not see Mt. Fuji (harder to see during summer anyway). The views got hazier once the rain started however.There is a café and toy store on the observation deck as well.
Great view, especially for FREE!!! . Two observation decks allow for FREE VIEWS of Tokyo and beyond! Yes, it totally free and the views are great! Don't waste money on Skytree, just come here!
Great site . Visited this place and was amazed to see its Size and design. Marvelous construction and well maintained.

Best view and it's free!!!. The government office has two towers that you can go up to look at the view across Tokyo, we did both. It's so worth doing as you get to experience the vista and if your lucky see Mt Fuji - very lucky as it is apparently only visible about 1 day per year. It is free to visit and is very close to other great areas of Tokyo. Really worth a visit.
Great view and free. Easy visit. Quick also and hassle free. Polite efficient staff. No lines on the day I went. Terrific view for free vs going to Park Hyatt and dealing with that hassle.

Definitely worth a visit - amazing view for free!. I visited with my friend and we went to one of the observation floors which offered an amazing view over tokyo and had all the landmarks labelled too. The only downside was that the queues for the other tower (presumably the one with the better view) were huge!
It's free but not much to see. We went there at night. The city lights are not very bright and the view is not much different than other cities. You won't regrade if skip this spot.

A must visit. The view is simply stunning. I visited at night so I can't comment on a daylight view (or mount Fiji) but considering it's also free, there's no reason not to. Easily located, it's the perfect photo opportunity. It really puts into perspective how dense Tokyo is.

Great free sightseeing spot in Tokyo. I visited here with a Japanesse friend late on a Sunday evening and loved the views. It took about 15 minutes of waiting before we got to the viewing floor. Great views, free entrance located closed to the subway station. Also they have many souvenir shops to pick up some trinkets for friends. One of the few free tourist sights in Tokyo. Fully recommend.

Forgot the Skytree, get free views of the city here!. Why waste 1500 yen on a city view in the Skytree when you can get 360 degree views for free at the metropolitan building? There are two towers and while both good, I think the view from the South tower was slightly better. On a clear day you can see all the was to Mt. Fuji!
Wonderful panoramic view of Tokyo!. We loved the experience of our visit to the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office. It was free and had great panoramic view of Tokyo.

Come for the free views, stay for the cafeteria! Seriously!. Other reviews mention the observatory, which is worth going for. The views are amazing and the Japanese toys, trinkets and other items are worth buying since you are out of the hustle and bustle of other area of Tokyo. However, I am recommending stopping by the cafeteria on the 32nd floor. When back at the lobby of the government building, you can ask any of the security staff for the cafeteria and you will fill out a card with your information in order to get a visitor's pass to the building. Take the elevator to the 32nd floor and you are presented with two "vendors" to choose from, each serving 10+ dishes each day. One vendor has the north side and the south side belongs to another vendor, so when exiting the elevators, make sure to walk around the central area to look at all of the dishes. Note the cafeteria is only open on weekdays from 11:30 AM to 2PM and form 2-4PM for lighter meals. Prices are very affordable. Last time I was there only a handful of dishes were over 1,000 yen.

Beautiful views of the city. We went in the evening and enjoyed seeing the city lit up! It's free to get in and worth the visit. We'd visited the Tokyo Tower earlier in the day and this was just as good!
Good buliding. Nice building with some garden outside. Olympic sign out there. You can go on the top floor, to see beautiful scene of Tokyo.
Absolutely do not miss. Amazing thing that the Japanese officials would offer a FREE panoramic views from the top of their building. Not even crowded!

Nice view. The view from the observatory floor of the building was decent on the day we visited. On a very clear day, you might even be able to see Mount Fuji. The one thing that made the experience less enjoyable was that the glass windows were a little dirty and smudgy. That affected our viewing experience. The best thing is that admission is free. For other observatories in tokyo, you have to pay quite a bit. So come here if you want a free skyline view of tokyo. But don't expect much.

Fantastic view of Shinjuku city. Visitors come to Shinjuku city must visit the observatory floor at the tallest government building. The admission is free but service and environment are very good. We went in the late afternoon when we could view the beauty of the city and sunset moment. The cafe there is not very nicely decorated and a bit noisy with so many visitors but it is good to relax after a long walk from the shopping center to the building.
The view from the top is subperb!. I was here in May 2016 to watch the city from the top of the South Tower. The view is superb and especially it is free.

Great views of Tokyo. Great views of Tokyo day and night all for free. We queued for about 15 minutes at around 9pm to get a lift up to the viewing area. Staff there are on hand to organise entrants and operate the lifts.The viewing area is on one floor and is fully enclosed so any photos will be taken through glass. The views are great and worth the time.There is a restaurant there and a souvenir shop. As usual in Japan, the are a few vending machines if you just need a drink.

Nice view. We stayed in a nearby hotel and decided to stroll to this building. View is great to see shinjuku area and rest of Tokyo. We came here during cherry blossom season so you could spot the areas in the city that have abundant Sakura trees. Line was a bit long, 20 mins to get up.
Great view. Highly recommended if you want to see Tokyo from above. The view is really nice. There is no entrance fee.

Free skyline view!. If you are near Shinjuku, this is a great way to see the city of Tokyo from above without paying a large amount of money. The observation deck provides a 360 degree view of the city.

Free view of Tokyo !!. A 20 min walk from Shinjuku station - the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building is a perfect way to view Tokyo from above without having to traipse to the Skytree or Tokyo Tower and pay entry fees. This attraction is free and once you are at the observation deck there are views from all sides of the building, two gift shops and a restaurant.
Free views!. Easy to find and access, very helpful staff, good views although the views aren't that exciting! Worth a visit
Great City View. Very nice to be visited also during the day, as this gives us a very nice view of the entire city... but half-hour is more than enough for it...
Free overview of Tokyo from the top. Nice place and high observation deck to have a nice view of Tokyo city. Need to arrive early to Que.There's rest at the floor.

Worth a visit!. If youa re lucky, you can have a small tour with cool policemen there. youc an see how prganized and professional Japanese people are. also, great look and view from the observatory deck at the top not always opem.

Night time views over tokyo. I was kinda disappointed with the view from the top of here which is silly because they are really beautiful and the attraction is free but it seemed like something of a tourist trap; at the top there's just two big souvenir shops selling loads of rubbish stuff that no one wants. The views were magnificent but there's no viewing deck, just large glass windows where you can look down upon Tokyo. Worth it as it's free but I don't think I'd go out of my way to get there knowing what I know about it now.

Different towers have different things in them. The Government towers are an amazing free observation deck with a view of entire Tokyo district. Totally jaw dropping. No sight of Mt Fuji today though, too hazy.I went up the south Tower first and there is a small art gallery, cafe and shops of Japanese souvenirs.(Some of which I did not see anywhere else Eg; Astro Boy). Went up the northTower at night and it is completely different. It has a restaurant and the items for sale are mostly food related. Be prepared to wait for a while to get down the lift again.

Great views and worth the trip. We were staying just down the street at the Hilton on the 37th floor, so I wasn't too excited about going here just to get a few floors higher. Well, I was wrong. This was a great side trip on the way to Shinjuku station. You enter the building and go down an escalator to catch the elevator up to the 50th floor. The place is wide open - there are windows everywhere and some gift shops in the middle along with a small cafe. As you walk around the perimeter of the building, they have overhead maps highlighting different sights. We thought about going up Tokyo Tower and the SkyTree, but after doing this - it's absolutely free - we didn't feel like spending the $30+ per person ($70+ for fast pass) to go up the SkyTree. Plus, we never really had a clear day - it was rainy season and was overcast most of the time. Don't get me wrong, I don't know that it's worth it to trek all the way here just for this, but if you're in the area or staying at one of the local hotels, it's well worth the time.

Fun, Free Attraction. The Towers are great place to visit! The view from 45 floors up,is amazing! The volunteer spoke English and did a good job in explaining what we were seeing. There are souvenirs to purchase and a restaurant . And...it's free!!!!!!

Fantastic View of Tokyo For Free. The 45th observatory is not too high but give me a closer look of the buildings below. There are maps and description about each significant buildings at each window. I can't imagine Tokyo is so large if not seeing from above.

Awesome View from Above. As I stayed at Keio Plaza, this TGB is just opposite , we took a morning walk there and its absolutely free to go up and the staffs were so helpful and polite.
