Nice place to view the city for free.. OK views from the top, especially at night. Only get the really good view if you pay to go in the restaurant, but going to the top floor is free. Nice to look back over the water, Haneda airport and downtown.

Great view, terrible decor!. Great view (try to time it for a non-cloudy day and you should be able to see Mt Fuji). The viewing galleries themselves though (one in the east tower and one in the west) are drab, dated and smell of damp. Go for the view, not the exhibits. Finally a free high tower view though (they are a rare occurrence in Asia these days).

For a free view of Tokyo, this is the way to go .... Really well organised. Bags are searched on the way in (because this is a Government building), but you take a direct elevator up to floor 45. It is a credit to the Japanese Government for providing this service to tourists for free (there aren't that many countries who would do this and it must cost them to provide it). There were also plenty of English speaking volunteers at the top when we visited, one of whom took us around to each window and pointed out all of the buildings. Very clean and well organised, great value. We didn't bother with the pricey and crowded Tokyo Sky Tree. Unfortunately we couldn't see Mt Fuji on the day we went as it was far too cloudy. We were told the only sure time to see Mt Fuji is on a clear day in winter, but from the pictures I can imagine that would be really breathtaking.

Nice place to visit. Easy to find, easy to get in, easy to get to the top, fine views if the weather is ok! There is a gift shop at the top with a lot of toys and trinkets, and a restaurant, it's quite a nice little place. Not much else nearby apart from a small park.
must visit. The view on top was superb. I highly recommend this. It's even free! We're able to see Mt Fuji, and many other landmarks. It's a must for anyone visiting Tokyo.
Great view. Great view overlooking all of Tokyo - it's free as well so that is good - well organised - queues are a bit long but it moves quite quickly

Great view! Free!. They check your bags beforehand so don't take anything you shouldn't, Government building. Can see most of the city. Gift shop and restaurant at top as well. PLAN TO GO ON A CLEAR DAY

good architectural to look at and taking pictures. the architectural of this building just awesome, but there is no shopping center nearby but it is near the park you can actually walk around the park.

Great free view!. Don't bother with pricey Tokyo Tower or Skytree-this lovely double-skyscraper is just as good and free.Great views-Mount Fuji on a clear day and a good shop.
Go early to avoid queueing.
The stylish Hyatt Regency is next door for a superb and surprisingly good-value buffet lunch.

Free views of Mt Fuji and Tokyo. This is well worth a visit to get a great free view of Tokyo. Go to the building and follow the signs to the elevators where and attendant will take you to the observation level.
There are 360 degree views, a small cafe and.. not much else. Its a great way to spend an hour, and fantastic value.

Tokyo from the Top.. What a location for getting an amazing perspective of the city of Tokyo. This is a free site and can get busy at certain times of the day. You may have to join a queue to wait for a lift, but it all runs very smoothly and efficiently. The only thing you can't control is the weather, but even on a hazy day you might be able to just see Mt. Fuji in the distance.

High Flying Bird's Eye View. On the morning we went, there was a very polite security check, without any delays, and a free, easy elevator ride to the top. From the 45th floor there were excellent 360' views, a souvenir shop and a cafe.
A view of Tokyo from above. The structure is perfect if you want to see a view of Tokyo from a higher perspective. And no admission fee.
Free views of Tokyo. Just walk in, line up, and take the elevator to the top. It is a spectacular view of downtown Tokyo, and if it is clear, you can see Mt. Fuji. It is worth going.

Don't go in summer. It is horribly hot in Tokyo in summer and they are in a electrical economy policy. So you will go up in a verySmall, slow elevator, crowded without any ac or ventilation.Upatairs, views are fair but not that good neither. Only shop is boring and poor. Nothing else to do.Want a nice view of tokyo and have a good time? Go to Skytree instead!

As far as the eye can see. My friend who lives in Tokyo took us here and I'm so glad he did. You get the full scope of the vastness of Tokyo and all of its neighborhoods from the top floor.I also really liked that the souvenir shop had Stamps in Kanji for English names Tips: there can be a line to take the elevator but my group was there mid morning on a weekday and it the short line moved quickly.

Great views... And FREE. Personally would not go past seeing this. Furthermore it is free (save the money you would have spent on Tokyo Tower or Skytree and spend it on something else), and the views are great. You can also do a free tour with a guide from the bottom floor who provides some good information on the building and the views. Departure is just based on there being a guide available who speaks your language. So when I arrived we just left and did it one-on-one. I took the advice of my guide and had lunch after at a cafeteria on floor 32 which was quite the experience of buying a ticket and collecting the food etc. Even got a seat with a view! All for a grand total of ~$5!
Decent view of Tokyo FOC. The view on the 45th floor is decent but not spectacular. Given it is free, nothing much to complain.
Free entrance. A very nice view in Shinjuku! Free entrancewith a nice - and cheap - restaurant in the top. Don't forget to take money because they don't accept credit Cards!

Free!!! Beautiful view, Free!!!. Did I mention this is free :) and the view is fantastic. Be sure to consider the time that you plan to go because the wait for the elevator can get fairly long. If you go at 5pm when everyone is at dinner you might be able to find a short line.

Height of 45 floors for free. Top floor of this building has observatory from where you can even see Mt Fuji if it's a clear day.The lift is high speed it takes few seconds to reach floor 45. So if you want to see the city from this height for free just go for it. Other places are not free e.g. Skytree and Tokyo Tower
Free!!!. If you dont wanna spend money for Tokyo Tower of Sky Tree, this is the best option! You dont have to pay for anything. Right in the middle of Shinjuku.

Free and Excellent View of the City. Dont forget to get the free city view on the 45th floor of building #1. Buildings as far as the eye can see! There is a gift shop and the restaurant smelled wonderful!!

Unreal viewpoint for Kanto plain. This observation deck was easily accessible, free and we had no waiting in line. The day we were there it was a bit hazy but we could still see Fuji - beautifulI enjoyed the high viewpoint as it gave me a better understanding of the Tokyo layout in its various train hubs. Ikebukuro (nearest hub to my daughter's home in Nerima) was clearly visible as well as the other major hubs. I had my little blond grand daughter with me when I visited. We stopped on one of the levels to observe some crafts people work. One man was a word working artist. Kalista and I watched a while and she had questions I couldn't answer (zero Japanese language skills). She posed them directly to the gentleman and he was so surprised and overjoyed he stopped everything and he and K made a special pair of chopsticks for her to take home. They sanded them with mulberry leaves. Magical moment - some will tell you that the Japanese are rude, but in three trips there, I've found quite the opposite is true. If you're lost, there is always somebody about to try to help. I love Japan and love visiting this Met centre.

An unimpeded outlook over Tokyo.. This administration building has nothing exceptional apart from the magnificent view on Tokyo of its two panoramic platforms at the 45 th floor ( 202 meters height), with a complimentary entrance. The view is almost the same since both Twin Towers. If the weather is fine, you can see at the West side the Fuji, the view is also magnificent when the sun lies down. The building is opened every day from 9:30 am till 11 pm, and is accessible free of charge, I went there several times and have never queued up. The stop of subway is tochomae on the oedo line, exit A4.

Great view-and free!. Forget pricey Tokyo Tower and Skytree!
If you want a fantastic 360 degree view of Tokyo go here-close to Nishi-Shinjuku Metro Station.
Also,use the money you've saved and have a great buffet lunch in the beautiful Hyatt Regency next door- fantastic value!

Value for money. This is one of the few places you can go to for a great city skyline that is free. The views are great and there is a gift shop at the top and a restaurant ( not sure on the value or quality of the restaurant ). It's easy to get to and quick to do so it is great as an activity in a longer day.
Great views for free. The best option for an excellent view of Tokyo. Close to shinjuku and for free!Good lights durign the night in the building itself

Great view for free. Went up to the South Tower viewing floor on a late Saturday morning. Such a good view and it was free, what more could you ask for. Virtually no waiting for security or the lifts. If the weather is a bit hazy, just come back on another day. And the tourist office on the ground floor is very convenient too.

Free Viewing Deck of Metropolitan Tokyo. The good point about it is that it is free. You can come to the viewing deck as many times as you like, so you can come once during the day, and once at night. No tripod is allowed though. The viewing deck offers great view of the Tokyo skyline, but unfortunately the glass windows are very reflective and a bit dirty, so if you want to have high quality photos taken of the Tokyo skyline, you might want to choose another place
Must in Shinjuku. Very beautiful panorama of Tokyo.If weather allows,it is possible to see Mount Fuji.Nice restaurant with great views.30-45 minutes is enough.Entry it's for free

Fantastic Views. Visited in May- absolutely terrific views of the city at the top and I think really worth it as it is free! There's a cafe and shops too if you fancy. As others have said, a really nice free thing to do. Terrific for photos.

Good View of Tokyo. It is a very high building with a good observation deck. It was free to go up, but you have to wait in a long line. There is a cafe that wasnt bad. I went on Monday and only the South Tower was open. Apparently the north tower cafe is nicer... Nice afternoon casual activity with friends. Good first date spot maybe :)
Must go. It has a wonderful view and you can see the north and the south tower. Although the south tower is more impressive. It's free!!!
Beautiful view . Worth a visit and has a beautiful view of Tokyo. It's also free which is unusual in Tokyo. It also has a few gifts shops and restaurant.

First stop in Tokyo. Visited this building on the day before i head back to Malaysia. Didnt realized the existence of tourist centre at the LG. Staff were polite and friendly, in according to your interest and budget, they suggested and sorted out attraction you might want to pay a visit. Viewing deck on both tower was great, with exhibition held during my visit.

It's FREE, so you have nothing to lose!. I was staying at the Hyatt Regency next door so I decided to check out the view here. I had some trouble getting in, the building has a lot of doors but some are not accessible to the public so you might think it is closed when it isn't. Anyway I went to the top on a cloudy day and took some photos. It was worth the 5 minute walk from my hotel. :) Great way to conceptualize just how big Tokyo is.
Graet views. It was worth lining up to take the lift and see the view. There is an excellent information and excellent souvenir selection for visitors. There's also a café (which we didn't try)

Great view and cafeteria . After experiencing the amazing view from the south tiwer we headed to the 32nd floor for lunch at the cafeteria. Loads of choice and all our dishes were delicious. Great value aswell at about 600 yen per dish.

Must do while in Tokyo. Fantastic 360 degree views of all of Tokyo and the for free! Have to a bag check before getting to the elevator as is expected for most towers these days. Small shop where you can purchase souvenirs.You can stay as long as you like.
Great views of Tokyo. Free viewing platform on level 40+ provides great view of Tokyo. Lots of souvenirs available for sale.
Tokyo from Up-Above. If you want to see Tokyo from high-above, this is one of the locations to visit. Trying visiting as close to the evening as possible when Tokyo lits up!

Great free view. Two towers to choose from. We went up the one with the café. No charge for going up. Had coffee and cake (800 yen) in the café. Walked through long tunnels from Shinjuku Station - but well signposted - that took us straight there.

Great Free View. If you're staying in or near Shinjuku, this is a great place to start enjoying the sights of Tokyo. The free observation deck offers excellent views of the Tokyo tower, the Sky Tree and the many other sights in the city skyline.

One of the best observatories I have been to. Just as many other travellers have described it: it's a free indoor observation deck, great almost 360 view (one section of it is within the cafe) There's also a souvenir shop in the middle with loads of nicknacks. If you are also into the real Japanese tourist 'must-do' of collecting stamps of sights, there's a stamping station within the observation deck.

Cannot believe this is free!. Fantastic view over Shinjuku, Central Tokyo and surrounding areas from the Metropolitan Government Office. The best part of the exhibit is that it is entirely free to visit and on a clear day apparently you can see Mt Fuji off on the distance. Tip: There is a very good tourist information centre on the ground floor which is handy for maps and general tourist info. They also run free tours of the observation deck from here.

What a Glorious View it is, Humid or Clear. Free Observatory? OF COURSE!! And I don't know if this is always the case, but there were some helpful guides once you reach the top and some students volunteered and set up camp with fun (free) activities to do. This was such a brilliant idea and really helped show Japan off to tourists.

Indoor Observation Deck. For some reason I was expecting it to be outdoors and was disappointed when we got there at night because the windows of course have reflections. Otherwise it was a great view, but our hotel had a great view. If I had known it was indoors, I wouldn't have gone.

Amazing view and free!. Overall Shinjuku is an an awesome place and definitely worth visiting! Just taking a look at all the skyscrapers is amazing. And one of the most amazing skyscrapers is Tokyo Metropolitan Building! Getting up is no hassle. They will do a security check. However they are very polite and will first ask you if it's okay if they check your bag. Of course you have to say yes, but they were much more polite and friendly than the guards in Main Tower in Frankfurt that I visited last year...The architecture of the bulding by Kenzo Tange is cool, strict yet elegant. Make sure to spend a few minutes outside in the square just in front of the towers before you go in. Reaching the top the view is amazing. You can really feel how vast Tokyo is and you get a great view of the other skyscrapers in Shinjuku as well! The view is quite different from Tokyo Sky Tree since Shinjuku is quite far from where Tokyo Sky Tree is located. You will have a better chance of seeing Fuji from Tokyo Metropolitan Building. The few downsides with this attraction is that the best view can be seen from within an expensive restaurant... And in addition it's starting to show its age, the carpet looked a bit worn down in the tower we were in. But these are small niggles, definitely make sure to make a visit if you're in Tokyo!

Free city view . Nice view of the city for free. There is a cafe on the viewing floor but did not try it. Several information boards so you know what you are looking at. Morning summer haze so could not see Mt Fuji.

Good view from observation deck. Do drop by for a nice panoramic view of tokyo skyline and even a chance to get a glimpse of Mount Fuji on a clear day. Getting to the building is easy, just take the 100 Yen bus which covers Shinjuku.
Great city overview. A free place to have a city overview of Tokyo .. You can visit it at night too! It's free and within the downtown. Totally recommended.
Excellent View. Wonderful view of Shinjuku and Tokyo surroundings. About the only free view you'll find too! Really easy to get to

go there if you want to see Tokyo from the top. this building offres fantastic views of Tokyo from the 42nd floor! go to the south entrance - less tourists, faster access to the elevator and much better views towards the city, direction Park Hyatt.open even on sundays, vrey friendly and helpful staff, volunteering guides on the 42nd floor available.
View of Tokyo. Great View from the top. Only one of the towers is open at night and a small queue to go up. They have a restaurant here also where you can sit and have a meal.

45th floor for the Observation deck and 32nd floor canteen for lunch!. Open till 11 pm, while staying across the Hyatt Regency, we went first thing in the morning and then again at the end of the day to see Tokyo in both day and night light.The kids like the toy and souvenir shop at the North observertion deck and it is a nice place to chill for a simple meal or drink.The 32nd floor staff canteen is opened to public. Get your cold soba at ¥390 or ¥690 for a fried pork cutlet with rice. Many other options. Select and pay at the machine and collect food at the counter. Find a seat facing the window for a great view of the city.

Awesome view. Easy to do. We waited maybe ten minutes for the elevator to get to the top and free of charge. We were going to do the Tokyo sky tree but read reviews it was hours to line up and overcrowded. The view at the top of the government building was fabulous and not overly crowded. If you don't have much time and don't want to wait in line this is a great option!! Recommended!!
Good and free. We went there in the morning, 9:00am I believe, and were the first ones in. The views are great and ita for free so definetely worth the visit.

Come for the observation deck. We were on our way to the Shinjuku tourist information office and stumbled upon signs of an observation deck, a top one of the high rise towers, so we ducked in. This is a free visit and well worth your time (15 min) on a clear day. You can see all around Tokyo, even as far as the Mt. Fuji. You will hear tourists speaking so many different languages as they gawk out at Tokyo. Plenty of snacks and souvenirs are on sale as well. Best of all, the tourist information office is just around the corner.
Good looking building.. Handsome looking building. It was my "very in your face next-door" neighbor when I stayed at Hyatt Regency Tokyo.
Its free!. Definitely a must see. You can see the view of Tokyo City from up here. Its air conditioned and you can have coffee/tea at the cafe too.

Great views from the government office - Free!. Great views from the north building. Closes at 11:00pm while the south building closes earlier at 9:30pm. We didnt get to see the south building but will try next time we are in Tokyo. Entrance was right across from the Hyatt Regency Tokyo we were staying at. And it's free!

FREE Panoramic View over Tokyo. Here you can enjoy a panoramic view of Tokyo from 45th Floor of Building No.1. The view is GREAT and it's FREE! When I was there, it was a bit cloudy, so I couldn't see too far (couldn't see Mt. Fuji clearly) but still, it was very IMPRESSIVE! I want to try again! Next time I'll go there when it's dark to see Tokyo night view! (Observatory deck is available until 11pm )

Observatory deck, tokyo skyline. Visited this place in the late afternoon to evening. The tokyo skyline is beautiful, you can see tokyo tower and skytree in a distance. Did i mentioned it's free? Yeahh this spectacular view is free. I found hard to take a picture in the evening, since the glass wall gave reflection so it ruined the photos (or perhaps it's just me not a pro photographer) There is restaurant on the observatory floor but it's fully booked :( so i grabbed drinks from vending machine. I suggest you to bring snacks before heading up.

Worth a visit. Bird's eye view of Tokyo . Need to go on a clear day to maximise the view. Sizeable restaurant serving meals including breakfast, small shop selling souvenirs. Have to go through security checks. Much quieter and less crowded than other high rise venues and no cost. The building has a tourist office on lower floors. Well worth a visit especially if you are in the area. Not far from Kieo plaza hotel

Free view over the city. This is one of the only places where you are security checked. However the service is nice and personnel speaks english. The view is great. Only minus is that restaurant doesn't accept VISA payment. Great place if you are nearby.
Great views. Great views of Tokyo and free! Enourmous buildings of the metropolitan government and one of the top floor is accessible in 2 of the towers. The views are trough the vindows.

Free observatory building. Go here instead of tokyo tower or tokyo sky tree coz it's free of charge and you get the same view to all over tokyo. Plus the employees there are very friendly and helpful. It's a walking distance from Gyoen National Garden and easy to find.

Ordinary view. I went to Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office building just because it was next to my hotel and promised good views. The views are from the 40th floor. Although I could see most of Tokyo city I could not see too much of Tokyo Bay as it was smoggy. Only a little of Mt Fuji can be seen due to cloud cover. There wasn't much on the 40th floor. There was a little Italian restaurant where the displayed food didn't look appetising. I would've preferred Japanese food since this is Tokyo and it's a tourist site. If I had wanted Italian food I would have gone to Italy.

Better view from South Tower. The Metropolitan Gov. building's observation decks are worth a visit if you don't want to spend money. The south tower has better views of Tokyo, but closes a little earlier (if I remember correctly).Whilst Tokyo looks best at night-time, the bright lighting at the observation deck level creates lots of reflections when it gets dark outside (hence the four star rating).

Nice view on Tokyo. Very high building, observatory in the 45th floor. There is a souvenir shop in the middle of observatory. Not bad, the view is nice, but nothing special either. Worth going if you are nearby anyways, but not worth going extra for this.

Free 360 views of Tokyo.. what else can you ask for?. It can get a little busy and lines can be quite long but its totally worth the wait. The views are amazing day and night (make sure you see both!). Why pay for other places when this is free?

Depends on the weather. A fairly slow queue to get to the viewing floor due to the security checks. Once you get up there, what you see naturally depends on the weather. Ours was a rainy, misty day so we didn't get a spectacular view. But it's still worth the time.

Free views of Tokyo, what's not to like?. This is a free, worthwhile attraction in Shinjuku. Bags are checked before you go into the lift which takes you upto the top floors (I can't remember which specifi floor is is!).Go at dusk, just as the lights are starting to twinkle. It is an incredible 360 degree sight, but it does get busy so you have to be ready with the cameras. The windows are slightly grubby in the popular spots so bear this is mind because you don't want fuzzy images! But for a free activity with no time limit, it's a fantastic thing to see in Shinjuku.

Free observation of Tokyo & view of Mt. Fuji . Good free views of Tokyo including Mt. Fuji. Queue was short when we were there, quick efficient customer processing. It's good for a half hour or so day or night.

Why pay when you can get it for free?. I recommend to go here to see the view. Even though it is inside, the view is 360 degrees, with displays that shows you what you are looking at. On a clear day you can see all the way to Mt. Fuji.

Interesting After Dinner View . Walked over after dinner. North Tower observatory is open until 10:30 pm. Free. Worth the visit if only to see the the glittering lights. Entrance is one floor below street level.

Gives you an idea of just how massive Tokyo is. It's well worth the trip up here to see just how massive Tokyo is. Unfortunately, the haze prevents one seeing out further where Mt Fuji can be spotted, but it's an amazing sight.

Free 360 view of Tokyo. We went to Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office around 8pm after visiting Ginko tree avenue in autumn and souvenir shopping at Oriental Bazaar in Harajuku /Omotesando. Tokyo Government Office was a great place for free viewing of Tokyo. We did asked for directions from local to get there as we were a bit confused of the direction. Make sure you have Japanese name of the building. When we arrived ...there is a short queue going up the building...once inside you will be surprised of the view...it was so breathtaking to see Tokyo at night. It was so beautiful and from up there you can see that Tokyo really is a huge city...a megacity indeed. And for us it was kinda of fun to spot familiar landmarks like Tokyo Tower and Skytree amidst all the lit up highrise buildings that characterised Tokyo. I love this place...such a great view for free. Come here if you don't feel like paying for Skytree or Tokyo Tower..:-).

Great view!. Went early in the morning, was quick and easy wait, 10 min, mostly for them to check people's bags. View was great, though was a bit muggy in the morning, so view was a bit hazy. Best part is that it was free.

Free views of the city. Definitely worth visiting- we visited this building and the Tokyo City View in Roppongi and the views were no better at the latter despite it being a lot more expensive. We visited the building just before sunset so it was fairly busy but the queue went down quickly.
Free to go up and worth it!. The buildings are located close to Shinjuku. It is free to go up so definitely worth a trip if you are in the area!
Must go place. Dear all, this place is free entry but this is a nice place and must go place for you to look at the whole Tokyo. You can see Sky Tree Tower and Mount Fuji from here.

Best Bird's Eye View in Tokyo and... FREE!!!. This is a "must visit" in Tokyo, it has generous scheduling and two tower options (I prefer the South Observatory). I recommend a 30-60 minute visit to take everything in and it's also stroller and wheelchair friendly.Please note:-The entrance is actually in the basement- Your bags will be "checked" on before entering the elevator- Confirm on the official website to confirm if there's a special event or something that will prevent your visit (They host weddings and other things sometimes, but this will usually only affect one of the observatories). I recommend a sunset visit, but it will be difficult to see Mount Fuji unless you're lucky with the weather.Other places in Tokyo offer a high view (Mori Tower, Tokyo SkyTree, Tokyo Tower, etc) but they're all expensive :( So this is a welcome option. Easy access via Oedo line and a short trek from Shinjuku station.There's a "fancy" coffee shop and a small gift shop at the top, just in case you want to relax or shop a little.
Interesting tourist visit destination. Interesting tourist visit destination. Nice place to walk and explore japan modern sky scrappers landscape.

200 meters above Tokyo. Nice observation of Tokyo city from 200 meters. The entrance is free of charge. High-speed elevator will lift you to the observation area. Personnel is very kind and polite. Also here you can find some volunteers who can conduct free of charge excursion in English
One of the best views of Tokyo. A perfect place to finish a stay in Tokyo, tjhe views from the 45th floor are breathtaking and it also counts with a very romantic restaurant to have dinner.

New Perspective . Part of Tokyo's appeal is its sheer size, something which the view from the 45th floor of the TMG building helps you to appreciate. We visited the North Tower at about 5pm on a weekday, and only faced a small queue when we arrived. After going through airport style security (beware, it says that you may need to present ID, although we never did) you are loaded into a lift and taken to floor 45. Upstairs you are free to spend as long as you like admiring the excellent view. Make sure to find the Fuji window if it's a clear day, and also check out the one next to the lift. It's also worth noting that there is a fun little shop selling souvenirs at reasonable prices. The only downside is that it is a bit of a journey from Shinjuku Station, but that can't really be helped. We'll worth the visit.

Great views of Tokyo and free entrance. I stay right next door at the Hyatt Regency and usually go up to the observation deck of the Tokyo Metropolitan Government building atleast once during my visit.The south observation deck is only open during the day but the north tower is open to around 10.30pm so great to go up during the day and then again at night to see all the blinking lights

Great views. If possible, visit Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office at night and you will be pleased with the awesome view of Tokyo.The observatory deck is on 45th floor. You have to go through a check point before entering the elevator. The ride was smooth and quick with an older lady serving as elevator attendant. She was dressed in uniform with impeccable manner. There is a souvenir shop and cafeteria on the same floor.

Great views for free.. Great views of Tokyo. Go on a clear day and you can see the mountain range in which Mount Fuji nestles. The tower offers a 360 degree view of Tokyo all for free. Outside the building are some dynamic statues.
It's free. It has a pretty good view over the city + it's free. I went around 8-9 pm and there were no lines at all.
Nice view. This building offers a spectacular view over the city. This is one of the places you get get a free of charge access to the upper floors. The view on Mount Fuji in winter is spectacular.

Great skyscrapres view for free!. A splendid view for either of the two towers (not connected with each other directly, thus you have to make a decision downstairs when entering the building) - for free! Open until late evening. On the top floor some cafe with a limited selection of food and drinks.
Nice views. Nice views of Shinjuku and other areas of Tokyo, it is really crowded on the observation deck though. The souvenir shops remove some of the experience, makes it feel a bit tacky.

Gorgeous night view of the tokyo city. This is a nice place for the tourists to enjoy the free tokyo city view from high perspective. The building have two towers and there was only one opened when we arrived here at night. We got a great exprience to enjoy the whole city view because this place was recommended by my japanese friend Hayashi san and she bought us to this place after taking us to dinner nearby shinjuku.Ps: recommend couples and lovers to visit this place as it's very romantic especially at night!!

Cheap and unique eating experience!. You will find one of the cheapest and most unique eating experiences in Tokyo at the workers cafeteria on the 32nd floor of the Metropolitan Government Buildings North Tower. View the plastic food models, pick the number you want, go to the colour coded ticket machine to buy that item and then pick up your meal from the colour coded section of the cooking area! Boyfriend got a fish dish that he really enjoyed whilst I got tempura vegetables served on rice (the only meal that appeared to be vegetarian). Both came with a couple of different side dishes and at 500 yen a meal were great value. Unfortunately for me the side dishes that appeared vegetarian, on taste test by boyfriend were found to contain fish sauce. The tower itself offers great views at both day and night and for free!
Views over Tokyo. Free entry, superb views over Tokyo! Elevators too small, so long queues at certain times of the day.

Nice views of the Tokyo skyline. Went up on a cloudy and rainy Saturday afternoon and the views were not picturesque at all. Try to go when the skies are clear as the views from the observation deck are very good.

Great View Even When Sky is Gray. Went with our family on Sunday (mid-day) was not crowded and the wait was less than 5 minutes. We never felt rushed and were able to take our time viewing Tokyo from all sides of the Observation Room. All three generations enjoyed the view and the casual atmosphere.

Outdated. Three stars because it was free. We went here to get a view on our hotel in the skyline. The top floor is almost empty, with old carpet and a tiny shop. We went to the Sky Tree the day before, although not free that was a much richer experience.

Outstanding Views for Free!. This was our first family trip to Japan and it was pretty awesome that next door to our hotel, the Hilton, was the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building. We literally crossed the street and there it was! We weren't sure where the door to the elevators were. You have to go to the back of the building to find it. We took the elevator up to the top floor and the views were awesome! The best part it is free! There are shops on the top floor and I even got a pressed penny of Hello Kitty with the Government Building in the background for 200 yen. First Souvenir of the trip!
Amazing tower. . At 45 floor. Easy to reach by train or bus! Shopping at observation area! Try to go day time. There is restaurant on the top to have a quick bites. Staffs are very friendly.

A great view for FREE!. My family visited the Tokyo Metropolitan Govt Office observatory tower one evening, Beautiful view without having to pay a dime. I'd highly recommend going to the observatory, night and day. You are able to even see Mtn. Fuji on a clear day from this observatory. Why not make use of free admissions when given?
Free . It's free easy to get to and find, it's near shinjuku so if you're out that way you should hit it, nice view

I wouldn't recommend going at night. we went at night and though it is free, i was a bit disappointed. Due to the lights from inside, there is a glare on the window making it impossible to take pictures. Plus, it becomes just a sea of unidentifiable lights at night. I would have preferred the daytime view. Anyway, its free so see for yourself.

Stunning views on clear days & evenings. The Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office is quite a walk from Shinjuku's main station (but is directly connected); however if you're looking for a free alternative to Tokyo Tower and Skytree, it's absolutely worth it.There is one observatory in each building - facing north and south - each offering their own unique 360 degree views over the city. Due to its' central location and free entry, the observatory gets extremely crowded more often than not - meaning you'll have to queue for the elevator to get in and out. If you can brave the crowds, visiting at dusk or in the evening offers stunning nighttime views of the city. There is also a restaurant and gift shop in the observatory - however they are overpriced (but not unfair, since entry to the deck is free).

Tokyo rarity: Free entrance!. Best free view of the city. Open from 09h30 to 23h00, the Tokyo Government building offer fantastic view of the city, from the south and north observatories. The top floor cafe is expensive but of course, you will also find vending machines at the top. The souvenir store alone is worth going up...

Great views. The observatory level gives great views towards Mt Fuji and Tokyo surrounds. Need to go through security. Just to check you are not carrying anything bad. A number of souvenir shops at the top.mwell worth the sunset visit.

Free Tokyo Tower. Fantastic, free view in the middle of Shinjuku. The observation height from the Metropolitan Government Building is comparable to Tokyo Tower, and although it isn't as close to Tokyo Bay — it still offers an excellent look over the city. There is also a government-worker style cafeteria open to the public in the building, if you're looking to try some standard Japanese lunch sets on the cheap.

Great views, plus it's free - how can you go wrong?. This offers a great view of Tokyo and it's free! You really can't go wrong - visit both towers for two different perspectives. Great to go at dusk so you can watch the city light up.

Quick, free, easy to get to, definitely worth it!. The views really are good. We saw it at night, I would recommend it if you're trying to fit something quick in. Also its close to the famous Yakitori Alley for yummy food!

Enjoy Magnificent view 360 of Tokyo .. Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building Observatory.Closing days :South Observatory First & third Tuesday of each month.North Observatory Second and fourth Monday of each month.Both Observatory closed during the New Year holidays (Dec 29-31 & Jan 2-3)Opening hours 09.39 - 23.00The South Observatory closed at 17.30.23.00 on days the North Observatory is closed.Free admission to enjoy view the city of Tokyo.Location close to Shinjuku Station.The observatory elevator from 45th floor, 202 meters above the ground level will take the visitor in 55 minutes smoothly. Visitor will get a direction from staff who wait for in front of the elevator. Its beautiful at night view 360 of Tokyo. There is a souvenir store.

Great view!. Neat to be able to go right up to the top and see the views. We had a cloudy day, and even so could still see quite a ways. Also a gift shop and etc at the top. Don't forget to get your free tourist stamp to prove that you were there!

View of the City. We stopped by here to see the start line of the Tokyo Marathon, and also check out the view of Tokyo. Free admission. We entered the building to see the north side to the observatory area and go through metal detectors. Take the elevator to the top floor and see the nice view of the city. Souvenirs and a restaurant were on the top floor. We went on a warm day, so the floor was warm.

Good view may not need to come with a price. Great view of Tokyo from the observatory tower. Suppose to be able to have glimpse of Mt Fuji on a good day but not on my day. Was able to identify Tokyo Tower and The Cocoon. All these nice view come FOC. And, the building itself is majestic.

great views. Great views. There was a bit of a line when you had to take the elevator. But the views are worth it.
There is also a souvenir shop and a restaurant.
I recommend going just before sunset, so you can see the views in day light and also at night with all the lights.

At least it's free. Things you should know about the Tokyo Metropolitan Building viewing deck:i) There are two towers that take turns opening every alternate day.ii) Be prepared to queue for at least 20 minutes.iii) The deck will be packed.iv) The glass is filthy with fingerprints. If you want good shots, bring something to wipe the glass. Or get a decent camera.v) It's tiny.vI) There are a few small but overpriced souvenir stores.
Nice view. If you want a free and nice view of Shinjuku and surrounding areas. Has a nice 360 view. A must go if you are in the area.

A free view. Went to the Skytree first as was told you get good views from there. But fog (and a high entrance fee) stopped me. So we went to the Met building instead. No entrance fee was a big plus. The floor has some souvenir shops and a restaurant. I went just before sunset, so managed to see Mount Fuji in the background first. Gor a lot busier in the evening. Well worth it for a short visit.

Good English speaking guide will be there for you. Stay near Hyatt or Hilton Area, just a walking distant to the building. You may go in the day time, then return other day for nite view. Is Free and please line up
Excellent views when weather is clear. Unfortunately the weather was foggy/smoggy, so we couldn't see as far as we would have liked, but the possibility was there, still interesting.

Nice view of the city, not much else. Went there at night.On the top floor, you can see tokyo through a thick glass window.Most of the space on the floor is occupied by a restaurant and a distracting souvenirs shop.Nice if you're already around, but don't bother making it a trip.
free observatory deck on 45th floor. Great panoramic views of Tokyo from the 45th floor. No fee and good explanation. Queue for lift was about 10 minutes. A good way to start exploring the city.

Interesting building. Lovely view.. This is an extravagant (yet sort of empty) building.In order to get to the observation floor, you have to take an elevator up, after going through and airport-like security check.The view from its observation floor is lovely, and the fact that there's no entrance fee makes it a cheap way to see Tokyo from up high.There's a small diner in the observation floor and a small souvenir shop, too.Other than watching the view for 15 minutes, there's not that much more to do in the building.
Very good view for free. Took the free elevator up to the platform and the restaurant. Good view. Can be popular since it is free.
Great view. Easy to go up to the top for a view of the city. Unfortunately it was not very clear on the day we visited. Fun to see the city from high up.

Free and epic. Went here solo for something to do and was really happy I did.
The fact that it is free was a bonus but it is seriously cool. Great 360 degree views of Tokyo with some great photo ops.
If in Tokyo and looking for something to do definitely visit here.

Late night visit. Great view on the 45th floor, long walk from the train station and inadequate experience. I was expecting more to be honest, the reflection from the windows are messing up your pictures, I think would be better to visit during daytime, definitely better quality of view, with better quality pictures.The building itself and the other buildings are massive, like you are in New York. I should of brought my DSLR with me to fix the reflection, but what can u do, next time.Done it and that what's count.

a city run like clockwork. great views of this incredible city, never a wait for the observation deck, with an outstanding snack bar and about 360 degree views of the city. On a clear day you can see Mount Fuji quite clearly. Also, visit the massive courtyard between the two towers.

Beautiful architecture for a government building. The Kenzo Tange designed Tokyo Metropolitan Government Center is an impressive post-modern building. While a large complex of three buildings, its exterior facade of repetitive small windows and the use of a rusticated granite base with polished granite above seems to reduce the scale of the building. Public iinterior spaces have been carefully detailed. The only disappointment was the observatory from which views were no better, and in some cases worse, than those from our hotel room at the Park Hyatt.

Great Views for Free. The appeal is that it is free and close to the train station and easily accessed. Well worth considering visiting as the views are fantastic. Souvenirs and café fare available so good for a short visit.

Best view for free of charge. Take a lift to one of the top level which is open to public and take in the breath taking view of Tokyo. On a good day, you may get to see Mount Fuji from afar. Best of all there are no entry free.

the highest in Tokyo. Before the establishment of the Midtown Tower, Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building buildings here the highest in Tokyo. This building provided a look at the beauty of Modern Tokyo for free from a height of over 200 meters. And it's free!Of course this interesting attractions lest you miss when you are in Tokyo.
Nice View for being free. The view is nice for it being free. Come if you are staying nearby or else not really worth the trip.

Free City view. The view from the top of the observatory is spectacular. On a clear day, you can see very far. As there are two towers, North and South, the line is not very long to get in. There are two shops, I think on the observation deck where you can buy souvenirs. The only drawback is that the restrooms are located one floor below and the only way of getting there is by stairs. So, for those in strollers and wheelchairs, it will be a bit difficult. The best part is its free. Overall, It is worth going when you are in Shinjuku.

Stunning view!. Just been there, it's amazing! The best part is that it is 100% free, they check your bag at the entrance and you are good to go. At the 45th floor, there in front of you, Central Tokyo. The staff at the elevator speaks english, better than the view guide. She is also cute. The view is stunning! Breathtaking.Drinks cost twice as normal, and they are not good at all, but you don't really go there to drink, do you? A must see!

Nice view. A way to view Tokyo from above. The view is nice and it's FREE. A downside is the café, which is really expensive and not that good. But luckily you're not forced to buy anything.The building is beautiful and it's location is easy to find.
Great views. Great views and free. Go to the south side so you see everything. There is a small gift shop at the top. Perfect sightseeing for a perfect price (free).

Amazing 360 View & Free. We went at 5pm on a Thursday, and there was no line. It's walkable from Shinjuku Station. An elevator ride takes you for free to the top, where (on a clear day) you can see Mt. Fuji. It was cloudy when we went, but still worth the walk.
Interesting place with good view. Views from top floor are very good though not much better if you are staying on a higher floor at nearby Hilton. Definitely worth the visit though.
Good view of the city. This gave good view of the city. The day was cloudy so we didn't see Mt Fuji. Can't ask for more when it's free.

Very beautiful place. Japan’s capital city, with its mixture of traditional and modern urban life, is the most popular tourist destination in the country. Sensoji Temple is one of its iconic historic sites, and the Imperial Palace provides a traditional and royal air. The city’s Ginza, the equivalent of New York’s Madison Avenue, is world famous, as is the Harajuku Japanese-teen street fashion that influences international fashion industry. While you’ll find plenty of authentic Japanese dining in Tokyo, you’ll also find top-quality international restaurants as well, since Tokyoites have a discriminating palate for authentic quality of international cuisines such as Italian, Chinese, French, etc. Sushi restaurants are plentiful in the outer market of the renowned Tsukiji Fishmarket.

It's free and on a clear day you see Mt Fuji. I don't know how often you can get a clear day but it is possible to see Mt. Fuji, Since this building is in Shinjuku you have a totally different view and perspective from Skytree and Tokyo Tower. the best thing is it's FREE. You can go in either of the two towers and depending on the time of day you may have to wait a bit but well worth it. We had to wait five minutes going up and about 10 minutes to come back down. The whole observation area is well done and has lots of signage so you can identify what you are looking at. It's also open late at night so you can see the view all lit up.
A must. I can definitely recommend you visit the Metropolitan Government Office for the amazing views of Tokyo & Mount Fuji - and its free!

A good, and free, view of the city. This beautiful building (I really enjoyed taking pictures of it too) has one of the very few free viewpoints over Tokyo, and over Shinjuku of course. The only regret is that it's closed by windows, without proper sky deck, therefore it's very hard to take a nice photo without reflections.

Ok but be prepared for long queues. World trade centre is better.. I have seen many reviews of this "free" attraction in Tokyo. I visited in May and after queuing for an hour got to see the Tokyo skyline. It was good but not as impressive as I expected. There is a nice restaurant at the viewing area but the windows of the building were quite dirty and reflective, so pictures were not the best.My tip would be to go instead to the Tokyo World Trade centre, which is close to the Tokyo tower. It is not free to go to the 40th floor, but the views are very spectacular. There is no food or drink available at the top so take your own. This is the place to watch the sunset over the Tokyo skyline. Make sure you get a good seat as it will be very popular just before it starts getting towards evening. You have a choice of vistas before you. The harbour area of the city or towards Tokyo tower. I spent a lovely hour or two watching the city come alive with the night lights. There is also some nice Jazz music playing in the background. A must for romantic couples to enjoy the sunsets.

See Tokyo Whole. I like it because it is free viewing tower. It is actually government tower place government offices. Tourists can climb up to see the view of Tokyo free of charge. The observation level also provide binoculars.
Really fantasic view of the city lights. There are a handful of spots in Tokyo to get up high and check out the city lights. This is the only one that is free. And that makes it the best.
Great view over the City. We visited both the north and south towers and enjoyed the views from both. Not too many tour groups in at the time and the queues were not excessive.
Free View of Tokyo. This is the free place to have a good bird eye's view of Tokyo city. It can be crowded on a weekend.

Amazing views. From the 45th floors of both towers you see fantastic views of Tokyo. On a clear day, you can apparently see Mt. Fuji. The North Observatory is open until 10:30pm. And the best thing is that it's free! There are also cafes and shops. I would definitely recommend this place.

The most best and free!. I would highly suggest going to this place. You only need to spend about half an hour here or less. This is the best place to see the whole entire Tokyo. This amazing city is huge!

Free Tour Guide. Aside from having free entrance, you can also be accompanied by a free tour guide. If you really like viewing cities in high places then this might be for you. Its not comparable to sky tree but if you have a tour guide then she will bring you to different areas in the building were they held government sessions and give you a bit of history. The guide also speaks in English.

Spectacular view. The Tokio metropolitan government building observation deck is the best free place to see the tokyo skyline from. The view was absolutely amazing. There are 2 observation decks, one open untilll 10:30pm so you can go and see the view from night. Defiantly recommend.

Amazing considering its free!. The viewpoints at the top of the building is fab, we were lucky enough to go on a day when you could spot Fuji. There were two different towers one had a queue and one didn't, unsurprisingly we chose the side with no queue, turns out when we went up the other side there was not a massive difference! Definitely worth doing over sky tree :)

A great view from the top. There is no entry fee, so great views of Tokyo for nothing. We went in the afternoon on a weekday and there was not a queue for the elevator. There is a restaurant there as well if you are feeling hungry and a small toy shop/kiosk selling toys and souvenirs.

It's free!. This observatory deck is not high as Tokyo Skytree or Tokyo Tower, Roppongi Hills, Sunshine City. But unlike those, it's free!Marunouchi Building's top floor is also free, but it is lower than this.
Free attraction. There is no entrance fee to go up to the observation decks. Gives a breathtaking city view of the entire Tokyo. On good days you may even see a little bit of Mount Fuji!
Good Information center. Went her in August with my son. This place has tons of book and maps of places to see in Tokyo. It is close to many of the sightseeing places in town.

It's free and accessible from Shinjuku. It's free and accessible from Shinjuku, so nothing much to comment of, even though Tokyo tower looked really small.Was there when the 8.5 magnitude earthquake struck and the building swayed. Nonetheless, even though they were not able to communicate in English, the staff managed to organise and evacuated everyone efficiently.

Birds-eye view...for free!. We went here on a Sunday morning at 10:00 AM and were able to hop right on the elevator. We actually went up in both towers so we could see the whole view of the city. Great place for pictures and to see how big the city really is. Unfortunately, no Mt. Fuji due to clouds. They had a lovely English-speaking guide who showed us around the South tower and was very kind. This is definitely a great alternative to the expensive, over-crowded Sky Tree.

Awesome Free View!. An awesome free view of the city, everyone should go up to the 45th floor and check it out while in Shinjuku! There are bathrooms on the 44th floor, along with a restaurant and a souvenir stand on the 45th as well. There are also maps that point out the major buildings in the vicinity like Tokyo Skytree, Tokyo Tower, etc. Definitely worth a free elevator ride!

Excellent FREE view of Tokyo. We first went to the North Tower and the view was spectacular!! We were able to see all of Tokyo on almost 360 degree, and the best thing is FREE, they take you to the 45 floor where they have a restaurant and a souvenir shop, and the same goes for the South Tower, the view is totally different, so if you have time please visit both of them, is well worth it, one tower is open latter than the other, unfortunate I don't remember which one.But I highly recommend visiting it.

The best panoramic in Tokyo. The schedules are the best. If you arrive at night you will have to get in by the downstairs entrance and to take a good picture you will have to cover you and your camera from the inside light reflection in the windows ;)

A free observatory with amazing views. I thought this place was great - a free trip to the top of a 45 floor tower with fantastic views over Shinjuku and Tokyo. Unfortunately it was too hazy to see Mt Fuji. There is a shop with tacky tourist stuff and a swanky bar. We stayed and had a drink in the bar (not badly priced at all considering the location) and watched the dusk.

Brilliant views for free. This is a superb free option for amazing views over Tokyo and a good alternative to paying to go up the observatory tower. Also, as it’s not so high, I would imagine that the weather conditions are less of an issue for guaranteeing a decent view. The queues were very short with minimal security checks (bag search) although I heard that it is very popular at around sunset time, so you may need to allow longer.

A spectacular view from the top floor - weather permitting!. We went to the top floor (on a very rainy night) to get a view of Shinjuku. The view was great but I think it would have been more impressive on a clearer evening. The gift shop located on the floor is very reasonable and sells some great items - perfect for souvenirs.The restaurant looked lovely, though pricy so we didn't eat there.

Free City view. No queue, no ticket, free 360° view from 250m+ of Tokyo. Go there on a nice day, 15 minutes walk from Shinjuku station. But the most interesting is the building itself and the others around. Unique piece of architecture.

View the city on top for free!. It was a cloudy afternoon when we went to the top of the North observatory that's why we were not able to view anything. But I'm pretty sure on clear days you can have good views of the city. The best part is its for free!

Free Views at 45th Floor. About a 20 min walk from Shinjuku, these twin towers are a great stop for views - take about 1.25 hr from station to towers and back. Note both towers are usually open - you can choose one or the other to go up. There is little difference.

Little bit boring . We accidentally stumbled upon here on our first day in Shinjuku. We were offered a lovely FREE tour, which was run by a japanese lady who spoke good English, and it happened to be her first day and first tour. Rather empty and not a lot to see, it was a great way to walk around the building and actually see how big it was in comparison to what we have back home. If you go up to the 42nd floor you can get a great view of Japan, and get a guage for where things are. Apparently you can see Mt Fuji on a day with great visibility. It's June now, so its fairly hot, make sure you dress accordingly. The information centre on the main floor is really helpful and has free wi-fi.
Great start off point. Good to view the whole of tokyo. The tourist shop allows us get more information and bought lego duscovery attraction at discount rate

Free view of an amazing city. This was one of the first things we did during our stay, since we stayed in Shinjuku. It was an easy walk to the building from Shinjuku station with a clearly marked path underground. The building itself was an impressive sight. Our view from the (south) observatory was really amazing, and they even had a large collection of local specialties for sale from the different regions of Japan. It was a ton of fun to shop around and see the fun and the weird and the delicious! Great trip.

Great observatory (and it's free!). There are two observatories (north and south), one of them open until 23:00. The view is great, you can even see Mount Fuji if the day is clear enough. And the night view is also impressive. Moreover, the waiting queue is not long in general.

Great observatory. They have two observatories at 45th floor: in the north tower and in the south tower. The north one is well located for amazing view of the city, nearby parks and other sky scrappers. Most importantly , the access to the observatory is free of charge. When I visited there were not many visitors and hence I could enjoy nice view of the city. Overall the structure of this building and its foyer is really grand.

Amazing view!. I went with low expectations, but ended up really enjoying looking at Tokyo from up there. We went in the evening on a Saturday and had to wait about 10 minutes to take the elevator. It was really amazing to just see city for so long. We couldn't see Mt. Fuji from the smog, but we could see Tokyo SkyTree. It's free and probably just as good as the SkyTree without the line up.

Free view of the city. This is a great place to view the city for free. Quite an impressive building & access to the viewing tower is quite easy. When you enter the building, go down the escalaators & you will find the elevator to the viewing floor. Before going into the elevator, you will go through security. Once you reach the viewing floor, you can view Tokyo city from all angles. It is said you are able to see Mt Fuji on a clear day, but on both my visits, I was unable to see it. There is a gift shop to buy souveniers & there is toiltes as well. there is no time limit up there so you can view for as long as you want.
great views for free. nice views and amazing exterior building specially at night. Quiet area and easy to get in. Close to the rest of skyscrapers in Shinjuku area
Wonderful view. At the 45th level of the Metropolitan building you've a wonderful view around Tokyo.Awesome ! This activity is completely free.

Free view with a funny smell!. Free to visit, awesome views and fantastic helpful volunteers full of interesting information. Funny musty smell inside... Just needs better air circulation. Def worth a visit! We did not wait long and had a spectacular view of Tokyo for free!

Great tourist spot offered by local government. The tower was under electrical maintenance when I went there for the first time. So I have to go again on second day. So make sure you check the availability of the tower before you plan to go there.The tower offers nice view of the shinjuku area at no admission fee. Nonetheless, the most significant part of the view has been limited to restaurant customers, which is a little disappointment. However, the tourist spot is quite popular so you may expect a short wait before reaching the observatory level.

Great view, great price. There's not much to add beyond what others have mentioned - free access to a great view of Tokyo. It seemed to not matter which tower you went up in. The day we were there was smoggy, so no chance of seeing Mt Fuji, but it was interesting to see how many helipads were located on tops of buildings nearby.
Free view.. Very nice free view - around you can see skyscrapers and there are not too much people. You can buy there also some souvenir.

Awesome view. This would have to be on e of the best places to view the city of Tokyo and it's free! Local guides speak English and are happy to share the sights of a city they clearly love. we even caught a glimpse of Mt Fuji.

Views from TMGO. We stopped by at the end of a busy day of touring, so didn't spend a lot of time there. After waiting in line, you are taken up in an elevator and can walk all around for great views on a clear day. Selling point: Free--and you know what you're looking at, as there are markers at the windows. For shoppers, there are lots of products on shelves all around. Although we didn't go back at night, we heard the views were spectacular. Downside: It's in a business district a bit out of the way (though a short walk from Shinjuku station). For us, it was just two blocks from our hotel: the Tokyo Hilton Nishi-Shinjuku.

Great free views of Tokyo. From the 45th floor of Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office you can enjoy beautiful views of the city. The building has two towers and the access is free. Great experience!!!
Beautiful, free views!. Get there early to beat the crowds - I got there for 10am and there was only one small tour group in front of me! Offers spectacular views of Tokyo for free.

Free top observation deck. Have breakfast on top of the building for $7 with a fantastic view of tokyo. Easy to find. And lineup was short. Cheaper than going to the tokyo sky tree to see the city view. How can you beat that!
Great view. This was the first thing me and my friends did when we got to tokyo! great place, and great view. No queue and free! This place rather than the Tokyo tower.

Great view of Tokyo. Free entry and separate access elevators from the average working areas make the wait minimal. The location was easy to reach and the top floor provided a great 360 view of Tokyo. Would definitely recommend if in the area.
NOT alternatives to Skytree!. If you want to see Tokyo high up for free,then do come here.Can't miss the twin tower sight from afar!If you have time & money to spare then go to Tokyo Skytree!
Good view. Good view and free. Open late. It was crowded, but we could see Tokyo well. The shops occupy a large part of the floor.

Spectacular FREE view over Tokyo, from above.. Spectacular FREE view over Tokyo, from above. Nice observatory tower and a place where you can get a souvenir (mostly food) from ALL other prefecture in Japan.
Well worth a visit. It's free and offers great views. No crowds either.There is souvenir shops on the observation deck. Located close to Tochomae subway station.

Nice View of the City!. This indoor observation deck is free to the public. Be sure to check what time it opens, I believe it varies from day to day. We arrived at 8am on a Sunday and it was closed so we came back the next day around 9:30am and it was open. When we arrived It's a really cool panoramic view of the city and it is completely free. I was told on a clear day, you can get a nice view of Mt. Fuji!

I love this building. Almost, but not quite, art decoish. Lovely viewed from the nearby park. Free access to the the 52nd (I think) floor viewing area, with some great views. Not so good as TOKYO CITY VIEW, but close. Excellent tourist office within.
Tower views. South and north towers have observation deck on 45th floor amazing views & surprisingly no charge even in busy times, staff handle queues into lifts very well . A cafe on 45th floor

Good Cafeteria Food in the South Tower. The Metropolitan Government Office not only offers a free great view of the city. It also has a hidden gem of a cafeteria tucked away in one of the floors of the South Tower. We went to the South Tower because we intended to eat lunch at the employee’s cafeteria after visiting the Observation Deck. Sorry, I couldn't remember which floor it is. You can just ask the English-speaking staff at the Information Desk because the cafeteria is easy to find. When we reached the cafeteria's floor, we followed the lunch crowd as it wove through labyrinthine corridors. The first thing we saw was a display window of plastic food replicas with English and Japanese description and corresponding price. As we walked further, we discovered that there were many more food displays that offered a variety of Japanese and international cuisine. Just choose your food, remember the code and pay using the vendo machines. There are separate vendo machines for drinks and dessert. Bring the color-coded ticket to the right colored kitchen counter and wait while they whip up your food. Cafeteria food at the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office lives up to the Japanese high quality standard. Why shouldn’t it? All the employees and guests eat here. The food quality is good and the price is very affordable. The cafeteria might not serve dinner because the kitchen closed after the lunch break. The South Tower is also closed every first and third Tuesday of every month so plan your visit well.

Great views free of charge. Quite simply this is one of the best possible views of Tokyo an beyond, and it's totally free. Might be best to go later in your trip, as you'll be able to pick out landmarks you've already visited.
Nice Views of the city. The Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office is very accessible and offer a very nice view of the Tokyo skyline -- for FREE!
As its free, quite ok. It's only on the 47th floor, so view is just ok compared to Skytree, but as its free, not bad if you're in the Shinjuku area!
Great Free Attraction. Interesting views from the Metropolitan Government Office. Recommend to visit on weekdays not weekends. There are two buildings and two observation decks to enjoy the view.

Quite the View of Tokyo at Night. On a recent trip to Tokyo, I went to visit the observatory on the 45th floor of the Metropolitan building at night. It is a free elevator ride up to the observation level. Unfortunately, at night, they do not dim the lights. There is a nice bar/restaurant on the level which has the lights dimmed at night and offers some serene views of the surrounding city scape. The bar/restaurant does have a small cover charge to enter but the prices for drinks are reasonable and worth it considering it was closed off from the crowds on the floor.

Totally worth it!. They have two observatories at the last floors, south and north, but you have to take different elevators to get to each of them.But it's a great view, and best of all, is totally free!

good place for view. It is free spot with good view.
You may enjoy some tea and waffle too (not free, absolutely)
Great View. Great view, great souvenirs. Don't miss it! It was cloudy the day we went up so we couldn't see Mt Fuji but the view of Tokyo was great.
far from station,use WE BUS100yen to get easy.. Pretty far from station.make sure which exit,and ride on WE Bus that bus are just 100yen and round trip around shinjuku.

Tokyo goes for ever and ever.. The twin government towers both have an observation floor near the top. Level 45 to be precise, and they are FREE.There was a slight wait as we were there on a busy Sunday but the staff moved the crowd efficiently and politely and before we knew it we had been loaded into a lift and were stepping out onto the 45th floor. The view just goes on and on without end and Tokyo is a marvel to witness as it spreads out before you. We took great delight looking for all the landmarks we had seen on the ground as well as those we hadn't yet found. There were enough signs in english and english speaking attendants that we found the whole experience comfortable and easy.There is also a gift shop and cafe and we chose to sit and have a beer while taking in the view.This is a MUST DO Tokyo experience.

Doesn't Meet My Expectation. It IS GOOD actually, if I'm not set my expectation high it would be getting a 4 stars. It is free which is nice, but still the moment I reached the top I am surprised that it wasn't an open space and the window is not clear enough to make it a "wow" experience

Great views for free. Great views for free, a little hard to find the entrance, it's under the road, but only a short 30-minute queue to go up and another 30-minute queue to go back down after. great views
fantastic view for free. Free access to a very nice view from top of the towers, including at night. Right in front of our hotel . Perfect for a quick first visit on the evening on arrival

Great view of the Tokyo area. Check the weather before you go up to the 45th floor, if foggy you will not see everything. As all reviews say, the views are better from the south building. Lines are long but move quickly.

Great views. Well worth any line there might be if you want great views of the area. On a clear day you can see Mt Fuji and the staff on hand will be more than happy to talk to you about anything. There's a small gift shop and restaurant when you reach the top.
Great View. I great place to get your bearings and great photographs of Shinjuku. Free admission fast lift to the top

Great views of Tokyo from the observation deck.. Free access to the observation decks on the 45 floor of the north and south towers of the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Office. There is also a tourist information centre on the ground floor. Go up there before midday as the view would be clearer.

turist. until 11 p.m. you can up to 45 floors for free with a wonderful view over Tokyo. We went there af 9 p.m. and the opposite directions an incredible lot of men in black suits were walking to the metro. Their working day was over.

Great view and free. There are two observatories, one in each tower. There was no line for the elevator going up and a very small line to come down. The view was very nice and they labeled what you were seeing. Unfortunately it was not clear enough to see Fuji San. I'm sure the view at night time is just as nice too
Observation deck. Free Observation deck from which you can admire the endless city of Tokyo. The views are breathtaking.

Wonderful view of Tokyo free of charge!. I do recommend a visit nice view over Tokyo. No need to pay anything this is free of charges. If walking go in to Shinjuku subway station and follow the signed walk way to Tokyo Metropolitan Government office
Free view of Tokyo. The views from this place is amazing, on a clear day you can see the mountains and the good thing is that it cost nothing except your time.

Not the best view in town. If its a clear day you can see mount Fuji. Thats about the only spectaculair thing I can think of. And maybe that its free. The other view places in Tokyo have a better view.
Go if your in the neigboorhood and have nothing else to do.

Good spot to just soak it in. We went on a clear "blue sky" kind of day. The line was long, with 20 minutes of waiting to get in to the north tower, and we viewed the whole level in about 15. But being tired we made the best decision of the day and went into the little sky restaurant for a drink. For the next hour we sat there with a glass of wine in hand and soaked it all in. By far the best view is from the restaurant, and there was virtually no crowd to impede the view. We ended up having a wonderful day.

Wonderful views and all for free!. Excellent views of the city from the 45th floor. You can go up in either tower. We thought it was unfortunate that the restaurant area meant that you couldn't see the views in 360 degrees but you can't complain when it is free!
Free View Observation Deck. Go to Shinjuku to the Metropolitan Government Building ,has tourist info centre and free observation deck with 360 degrees

Great view. The Tokyo Metro Govt Office has two towers, each with it's own observation deck. When we visited in May 2015, only the south tower was open. The observation deck is free to visit, which is a huge plus in my book, and the views of the city are spectacular. It's hard to comprehend just how large Tokyo is unless you see it for yourself. One complaint is that in the south tower observation deck, there is a restaurant, and it completely blocks the view of all the recognizable landmarks like the Tokyo Tower and Skytree, so you have to eat the restaurant to get the view. Otherwise a pretty good alternative if you don't want to pay to go to the Tokyo Tower for a view of Tokyo.

Nice view on a clear day and it's free!. Well organised, nice views on a clear day.It's really easy to find and there is also a restaurant with great view. We didn't eat at the restaurant but it looked nice.Worth going.
Great City View. You get a greater appreciation of Tokyo when you visit any of the tall buildings in Tokyo however this would be the best for a near 360 viewing - with no fee or charge.

Just OK - but its free. The fact that it's free is the main reason to check this out. It started getting a little overcast when we arrived at the building, but the views were still good, if not crystal clear. The condition of the observation area was not what I had expected. It was a little run down and some of the windows could use a good cleaning (or complete replacement). We didn't spend much time here, and only went up in one of the two towers. If you're looking for something free it's worth a visit, but if you're short on time and have other observation deck opportunites I would probably pass on this.

Worth to visit. Anyway, it's free of charge. I and my husband visited both towers. The view from there was great. I visited on April 2015, it was free of charge. All the staffs are friendly (well, I my opinion, Japanese are the friendliest people in the world).
Good experience. Very nice views of Tokyo and best of all, it's free! Don't buy any souvenirs tho as they're quite expensive.
Courtesy of Tokyo Metropolitan Government!. Free of charge, easy to find, fast lift, great views. Huge tourist tat shop and (largely empty) cafe / restaurant at the top.

Great Views...and its free. Get a nice clear day, and given all you need to do is turn up and ride the lift...the views are stunning. There are the usual options to part with cash for mostly tacky souvenirsCan't find a reason not to do this...unless you hate heights.
360 degree free view. Better views than the Sky tower and FREE! There are two towers and both have lots of room so can handle many tourists. You can even see Mt Fuji from the towers
Great lookout and free. Long queues but they move fast. A restaurant up the top which looked reasonably priced. There are two towers, North and South. It's close to Shinjuku station.

Nice views, FREE. Better than you might expect for free. Lift to 47th floor of the North Building which is open during the day & evening. Nice views in various directions. Didn't wait long for lift. Friendly staff. Souvenir shop & cafe

Gives a great view for free!. Although it only gives the view on three sides because there are two buildings across each other. If you're looking for something free then this gives a great view.
Tokyo Best views:
https://thebackpackingballerina.wordpress.com/2015/04/30/getting-the-best-views-of-tokyo/
Great view ofTokyo. Saw Tokyo from the 45th floor. Phenomenal view. Good restAurants on this floor. One must ensure that this visit is done

Amazing views and it's free - what more can you want?. I went from the hotel across the road. Just a quick 5 minute walk from the Hyatt and short lift trip up to the 45th floor. Great views. Really good signs showing the local attractions and the size of Tokyo. It is free so well worth the time. Difficult to take picture at night so might be better in the daytime but if you have to work still worth the visit. It's open till 11pm so all good.
great views. Forget Tokyo Tower and Tokyo Tree. Free observation deck til 10 PM. Walking a few blocks fro JR Shinjuku.

Great view for free. . Worth the trip to catch stunning views of Tokyo. Ni fuss to get there and as always the staff are very helpfull. Two towers available to see really no difference which one you choose.

Perfect free views. Tokyo city government high rise office bldg offer a totally free observation deck on it's 45th floor.It is in Shinjuku, western Tokyo, so it's little bit closer to Mt.Fuji which can be seen on a clear day. There's a restaurant on top, so you can sit and enjoy 360' views, from Fuji over the Tokyo tower and Tokyo bay up to the Sky tree in the north east part of the city.

Well Worth a Visit. This is a great place to see downtown Tokyo. The observation spot near the top of the building is free and gives you a 360 degree view of downtown. Only about 10 mn walk from Shinjuku station.

Free view of Shinjuku. For those wanting to save some yen, but still want to see a view of all the cool buildings in Shinjuku, head here for free views of the city. I always take visitors here, as you save a ton of money by coming here. Definitely worth the trek.
Nice free view of Tokyo. Worth visiting as it is free and offers a great view of Tokyo from up top. There are shops and a restaurant that are only after tourists

Nice views of Tokyo city.. Free entrance to both South and North tower. Niight views only from North tower as South Tower closes at 5pm. For view of MT Fuji on a good day, go to the North Tower. Place is just 10minutes walk from Shinjuku station west exit. Enjoy!

View from the top is nice and free. Nice view from the top floor that is easy to access and free. There is a gift shop and small cafe at the top as well. Supposedly you can see Mt.Fuji from here on a clear day.

Excellent place to get a free city view from above. This is a nice alternative to the Tokyo Skytree where you dish out between 2000-3000 yen to go up. Sure, it's not in the same area of Tokyo, but on a clear day you can spot Mt. Fuji. Once you reach the top, there are shops for souvenirs and gadgets as well as a quite nice looking restaurant (didn't try it).Highly recommended!

Free sky scraper attraction. Instead of going to Tokyo tower or Tokyo skytree, I went here to experience the view of Tokyo from above. The good thing about this place is we don't have to pay to climb up unlike the other tower.
Place to see Tokyo from the top. On a clear day, one can see all of Tokyo even as far as Fuji if lucky. Best of all, it is free. Everyone will like it

Free view of Tokyo, great on nice and clear day. This building offers free Tokyo view from twin observation floors and on clear day even view of Mt. Fuji.
